Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: nettynkev
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four and this was our two night hotel assigned to us through Virgin prior to our Carribean Cruise which we were picking up at Fort Lauderdale. First impressions of the hotel were a bit unsure as we arrived round the back of the building after being dropped at the wrong location by a taxi driver. My partner went round to the front to see if we could get help with our luggage and a few mins later a concierge came round with a luggage trolley to assist us. The front lobby is lovely, very big leather sofas and a great feeling of space and cleanliness. We were then taken to our rooms after a very easy check in. The rooms themselves were also lovely, very clean, spacious and had everything you would need for a comfortable stay including dressing gowns and room service if required. As it was Valentines Day when we arrived I had pre-booked a table for two for myself and my partner as a surprise. The meal was fab although a bit pricey but it was a special occassion. We were on the 15th floor and the views were stunning, on the 8th floor where the restaraunt and swimming pool are there were fantastic views over the bay. Coconut Grove is a very desirable area and comes alive at night with all the outside cafe bars and eateries. In all I would recommend this hotel to anyone as either a base for exploring Miami or just a short stay as we did. If we go back to Miami we wouldn't hesitate to stay at Sonesta Bayfront Hotel again. Photos to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: GVAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great room (living room and bedroom) with a view of the bay for 2 adults and 2 kids. Pool is nice with jacuzzi, breakfast was really good too.Shops in Coconut Grove just around the corner. Highly recommended for families. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service during our business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was very friendly and accommodating, from the front office to sales/catering and shipping/receiving departments. Of special note---the excellent services of Ebru and Princess in the Sales office, Cassidy in Reservations and Johana in Catering, not to mention the extra special care we received from Omar Aguilar and Frank Ruiz. There was not one thing we could have asked for with Frank at our service, who anticipated our every need. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will return if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “fustrated”
Reviews.Author: Maria E
Reviews.Content: Made reservations in Dec 2011 for reservations in March, 2012; 1 dbl bed room and 2 - 2bdr suites in order to accommodate our 10 family members. My 60th birthday celebration was being held nearby starting at 6.00pm. The family arrived at 4.00 pm (check in was at 3.00pm). The single room was ready; however, the two suites were not ready - only one bedroom of the two suites were ready. The other 3 rooms had to wait. Carmen the front desk person was very apologetic...the previous folks did not leave on time.... bla. bla bla. At 4.30 we still did not have the rooms and decided to go and request another single room for people to get ready. Around 5.45pm the cleaners finished and we were able to move to one of the 2- 2bdr suite. The other folks decided to keep the single room and or the partial suite. Upon arrival back to the room - the single room had water leak all over the bathroom floor. Carmen offered to discount the room rates, which was appreciated but the situation caused all of us to be late to the celebration and unecessary stress.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water?”
Reviews.Author: Intcopiers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a single night before joining a cruise in Miami. The location is nice with good views of the marina. Rooms were a little dated but clean enough. When I went to shower in the morning I discovered that the hot water was off. Not wanting to cause a fuss took a cold shower and decided to report the problem to reception on check out. When I informed the receptionist she told me they were aware that my room had no hot water due to maintainance. Avoid at all cost.................

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Sonesta”
Reviews.Author: azile1710
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sonesta for a night following a cruise. The experience was excellent- we were upgraded to a bay view and customer service throughout our stay was superb. The room was spotless and the bed, linens and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The pool deck is wonderful, with incredible views of the ocean. Unlike other reviews here, we had no problem with hot water or water pressure. We asked for a cab to the airport after checkout, and the hotel staff had one waiting for us. The location is also great in Coconut Grove- lots of great shops and restaurants easily within walking distance. This hotel was just excellent, and ended our vacation on a very high note. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Especially nice for UM parents”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: Since Coconut Grove is the hangout for UM students, we decided to stay in the Grove so my daughter could get the full UM experience. We stayed in a 2BR suite with bay view. The layout was great for our family and the view fantastic. Two kingsize beds, and a comfortable sleeper sofa in the living room. 2 full baths and a powder room. Having a full kitchen is great, especially because the refrigerator has an icemaker. There is a CVS close by that has a nice selection of snacks and beverages to stock the kitchen. We got room service every morning for breakfast, and a couple of times for dinner. The menu and service are from the hotel's Panorama Restaurant one of the best restaurants in the Grove, and will not disappoint. We had sashimi, steak, etc. Everything was great. For breakfast, pancakes, eggs benedict, etc. All delicious and served piping hot. My only issue with room service was that frequently they didn't bring the right number of "set ups" so we were short silverware and napkins, but thankfully there is extra silverware in the kitchen. On our last night, I called the front desk very late and asked about the possibility of a massage. No problem, within the hour, not one, but two massage therapists arrived to give our massages. I was surprised to get such great service at the last minute. My only complaint was with the bathroom. Hot water was not really hot, and as I understood it from maintenance, it's something they are working to correct. My husband attempted to use the jacuzzi and it apparently hadn't been used in some time and spewed some residue. On this particular day, housekeeping had not come, and as it approached 5 we were concerned that we were going to be skipped and have to deal with the tub ourselves, but the front desk made sure we were taken care of. I wish we could've gotten later check out, but that's a problem with all hotels. They were very accommodating and allowed us to leave our bags and car parked with valet so we could walk around CG before heading to the airport. I would highly recommend the Sonesta for any stay in the CG area, especially if you are visiting UM. Great view, great food, and a charming community.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and the surrounding!”
Reviews.Author: Carven75
Reviews.Content: We went to Florida in August and finished off our 3 weeks trip at this hotel. What can i say it's a gem! I was glad we made the decision to not stayed at Miami Beach again. Because Coconut Grove its simple beautiful. This hotel is gorgeous, very boutique style ,staff were very good, rooms were big as there was me, my husband and my 2 boys, we asked for twin beds but they were huge (they even put in an extra bed for our oldest for free) there is also a kitchenette ( handy when you've got little ones) and a fantastic view! The pool area is gorgeous and with a view to die for. The surrounding was great just a short walk you'll get restaurants,shops and cinema! And if you've got a car do not use the valet as we think its crazily over priced just look around lots of cheaper alternatives for parking in the area. Overall we loved it. Would definitelty come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: travel-king13
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Booked on Hotwire so that is probably why I got the smallest hotel room I've ever been in. There was a king bed and no room for much else. I was solo and only needed the room to sleep for a few hours. The location was great, huge park across the street and the Bay just beyond. Coco Walk right next door for shopping and dining. Also a Starbucks for morning coffee. I'm sure some rooms offered a nice view, mine however did not. Overall not too bad for the price I paid but wouldn't pay full price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “3 day meeting”
Reviews.Author: Isabel B
Reviews.Content: I want to Thank the Sonesta Sales team for their support in helping organize my meeting. A special Thank to Omar Aguilar, Frank Ruiz, Jose Hernandez and Michael Meyers for their extraordinary and unconditional support, the team has been very attentive to our needs and always greet us with a smile; will definitely recommend to do your meeting at the Sonesta hotel in Coconut Grove you wonâ€™t regret it! Isabel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel on a business conference. I have to say that I was very impressed overall with the hotel. The hotel food was delicious, and the terrace with the pool was beautiful. But I have to say the best part was the friendly staff who went above and beyond to make you feel comfortable, particularly Frank and Omar, who worked our meeting. Overall, if you are staying in the area, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “In the Grove!”
Reviews.Author: golfingirl2
Reviews.Content: We go to the annual Coconut Grove Art Festival most years and have stayed in the Sonesta 5 or 6 times. The lobby is very upscale and attractive, front desk service is very prompt unless you happen to arrive at the same time as a large group checking in, there is NO parking except valet ($23 daily plus tips), but this year the valet service was much more prompt than in the past. Room housekeeping was excellent one day and then the following days there were minor issues, but not of great importance. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows; we had a full kitchen which was nice (ice maker so you didn't have to continually fill ice buckets)..the room was fairly spacious ....balcony same size on all but the larger units. Our bay view was on the side overlooking the pool and it was noisy (you also got a lot of noise from the restaurant on the same floor as the pool), but we turned on the ac fan and didn't hear a sound during the night. Privacy between adjoining balconies on this particular room was only a canvas panel and therefore not as private (sound) as the ones having concrete/glass dividers. One GREAT thing was that you walked right down the front steps and you were at the entrance to the festival. I would recommend the hotel and we will go back. There seems to be a wide variety of 'pricing' ...so keep that in mind. Loved watching the boats in the bay....lights of Biscayne at night, and overlooking the fun and sounds of the Art Festival.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need on your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Staylongernexttime
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sonesta. Hotel location is great away from the busy scene such as Ocean Drive, the bay on one side and lots of shops and resturants just a short walk away. We had a 2 bed room which was very large, with a little kitchen area, beds were very comfy. On arriving we found that our balcony door would not shut, we called front desk who sent maintence up immediately to fix the lock, one of our bedside lamps would not work, not really a problem as there are lots of other lighting in the room. Hotel staff were all very friendly, they helped us organise a tour bus trip which is well worth doing if you are without transport. We also used the train for $2. We enjoyed our stay and would return without hesitation. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but unexceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryan c
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta is in a great location right on the bay in coconut grove, very near shopping and some decent restaurants. The hotel itself is standard american hotel modern, clean with nice rooms. The restaurant is not that great but is located on the 8th floor with great views. I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay in coconut grove in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mcguche
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Miami and a 4 day stay at Sonesta. We loved the hotel and it's location amidst all of the shops and restaurants of Coconut Grove. The rooms are spacious, very clean and the beds are exceptionally comfortable. The staff are warm and gracious and try to accommodate every need. The pool is beautiful with an incredible view of the bay. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: Chucks41
Reviews.Content: Really terrific service, as always expected from a Sonesta hotel. The staff excels in going out of their way to make you feel welcome. Location was terrific also. Parking was too expensive, and should be included in price, but other than that, it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights pre-cruise at the Sonesta Bayfront and the entire experience was excellent. We just wanted to relax and get over our jet lag and we couldn't have asked for better. Our room was large and spacious with a kitchenette, which apart from the coffee machine we didn't make use of. We had a side sea view from our balcony. The 8th floor pool area was very chic with comfortable sun loungers and other seating and the drinks service was very good. We loved the shopping area which was so close to the hotel and we went to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner both nights as the range, quality and prioce of food was great. Next time we are in the Miami area we will go back to the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I've been spoiled beyond belief by this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler. At one point I traveled so much that I wasn't sure that I even had a home base anymore that wasn't an airport. I've stayed at so many different hotels, mostly 4 and 5 star places and my level of expectation is high, while still appreciating someplace that is not overly done to the point of tasteless and extreme. My many visits to the Sonesta have left me now completely spoiled. And not nessecarily by the decor, it's simple, modern and understated, but by the staff. It could be 6 months between my trips to the Sonesta and they still remember me by name, they remember what it is I like to drink while at the pool, my seating preference while dining, and my preference for suites, as well as how much I enjoy their in room massages. Now, the really good stuff.... something I highly recommend. If you can, take advantage of their private dining on the beach. It is beyond romantic and the staff have it down to perfection. The delicate rose petals gracing the ground..... the dinner delivered to your table by the staff, unobtrusively, quietly bringing you exactly what you need, but never hovering too close..... the candles lit everywhere..... you can't help bu feel like their most important guest and like you are of celebrity status..... and that goes for the entire trip. No, it's not the Breakers, with an old world elegance (something that I do enjoy) but there is just something about this hotel that while large, gives it a very personal feel..... and do try the in room massage if you can, there is something just so relaxing about getting a massage while looking out of your suites windows down to the ocean while listening to the breaking waves..... I can't say anything else about this hotel except that I highly recommend it on every level.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice visit”
Reviews.Author: JoanneRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended period of time and found the room to be extremely clean, spacious, and with a lovely view of the bay. It is a bit noisy during the day, because it's on a busy street, but by sleepytime it's nice and quiet. It's within walking distance to a shopping center with a Gap, other clothing stores, a cell phone store, live music, eateries and a multiplex movie theater. Our travel agent got us a 50% discount on the rooms and a free self-parking pass. I would negotiate the room rate because the full price is high. Definitely use self-parking. It's quicker and easier than valet. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed the restaurant, also. The Peruvian Caesar salad with an entire NY strip steak was my favorite and my husband liked the ceviches.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: pagetravelers
Reviews.Content: My in-laws stayed here for a week over Christmas. They were in love. Every day all we heard about was the great service and staff at Sonesta. They are already going to book a trip back in March. The rooms are very spacious and have beautiful views of the bay. The restaurant, Panorama is one of our all time favorite restaurants in all of Miami. The location is perfect to walk to everything in the Grove. The valet guys were very friendly towards us every day several times a day coming to pick them up. They never gave us any hassle like most places would. Overall, they were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: NPiskuric
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel for group meetings twice now and I'm looking forward to my upcoming trip. The hotel is clean, which is a priority for me. The service is excellent - there is clearly a focus on making the guests comfortable. Room service is very good, as is the food served at our meeting - all of which comes from their restaurant. While it's true that this hotel isn't brand new or what I would call super fancy (I have pretty high standards), I've chosen to return twice now. The beds are comfortable, the water pressure is good, the view is very pretty and the location is great. Logistics info: FLL airport is a 30 minute drive (pay for the sun pass that lets you use the express lanes).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetnews
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite w/agreat wrap around terrace and view of the bay an city. Panorama restaurant food and staff was great in the hotel. The front desk was very helpful and the front door valet was as well. This was a really wonderful location and stay.i will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: patriciapilates
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really great. The pool on 8th floor was perfect . Room was immaculate and bed was so comfortable especially the good quality bedding. All staff were more than helpful and nothing was a problem. We stayed a total of 9 nights and loved the area So much to do in Coconut Grove and still near enough to get to South Beach . restaurants in Coconut Grove were super especially Le Bouchon 5 mins walk we went for breakfast every day and got fresh baked french bread . Also Peacock Garden cafe next to hotel very good. The hotel restaurant was superb and for drinks at sunset hard to beat the view Try the Big Bus Tour for a great sightseeing tour at reasonable cost. Lots of shops and cafes to walk to and a cinema where you could have dinnr and watch film. All within walking distance of hotel Some of the staff who were exceptional are Freddie & Daniela front desk, Edra restaurant/bar, Gustavo at concierge but really all were outstanding. Loved th ehotel and will go back

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret C
Reviews.Content: I came to this area for surgery and needed a comfortable place to stay post op. we had a one bedroom with a ocean view and it was gorgeous and very comfortable - the perfect healing environment. The staff is courteous and unobtrusive, the location is within an easy walk of many things and the setting is beautiful. Very comfortable bed, linens, well stocked little kitchen. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Consistently a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Eric J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Sonesta now three times, and each time has been consistently a pleasure. Our rooms have always been clean, toiletries stocked, the staff courteous, helpful, and professional. The amenities are top notch, and the food is delicious. This is what everyone wants in a hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, furniture a bit dated but overall a great place to stay in Coconut Grove!”
Reviews.Author: LynnGibb
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline and got these rooms for $125. But if we had paid full rate, would have been a bit upset as the furnishings and rooms are somewhat dated. This is not the Ritz! In fact, in one of our rooms, the outlets didn't work so my daughter couldn't do her hair. Otherwise, the balconies were nice as was the pool area and pool bar. Nice place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/area, minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: GeTrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for a week. The property is neat and clean, good smell everywhere, location is good, in about 1 hr drive you can get anywhere in the area from Key Largo to Fort Lauderdale. There's no beach nearby but parks and the marina. Good and quieter alternative to downtown or South Beach. We booked online a "good" deal (about $230/night) for a superior with breakfast and found out that actually superior is like standard (..confusing, since online there was the option standard/superior) therefore the smallest and least expensive. The room has no carpet but tiles (great for people like me that do not like carpet that much), no balcony, it is clean with a comfortable bed and very soft pillows, however it needs maintainence. There were a broken door handle, the curtain didn't slide and its pulling handle was missing, the bed had conceiled sharp edges around, ac was very noisy to the point that we had to turn it off to sleep, sink was almost clogged and bathtub with curtain (for this kind of place i would rather expect a glass). The restaurant is excellent and the staff is very kind and helpful, however we discovered that the included continental breakfast was actually just a $10 credit each, however value is great as well as food. Menu is well worth a try and the view over the bay is of course amazing. Valet parking available for $23 or nextdoor self in'n'out for $15/day. Internet only available for a quite high charge ($6/15min). 4th out of 129 in miami makes me wonder..

Reviews.Title: “Another great return!”
Reviews.Author: tabascomom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual Christmas trip to the Sonesta in Coconut Grove! It was our fourth trip there this year. Everything is always wonderful from our arrival to our departure! The front desk always remembers us as do the bellman. The room is always ready for us and is always perfect. Our "Old Friend" Alex at the pool always knows what we need and our "New friend " Mark has get it down now too! It is a Condo Hotel so it is not a big hubbub in the Lobby and the Pool area is small but always adequate. They have some interesting new Water Drinks to cool you off at the pool! The Sonesta is a very relaxing place to be with a very open feel. Great views!!!! We'll be there next month!! Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve 2012”
Reviews.Author: DebiPittmanWilkey
Reviews.Content: What an incredible experience moving into the New Year while staying at your hotel ... can't beat the location, the view and the upbeat, celebratory spirit of your staff... !!! Thank you again and AGAIN for a fun and memorable celebration !!! See ya next year !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice yet aged rooms. Lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Was there on holidays for 2 nights. Hotel location is good and rooms, as typical in the US, are large and spacious. Booked a suite with two rooms as was travelling with my 2 children. Can't judge about breakfast as we find it a rip off unless you are really prepared to eat a lot. On the positive side, beds are comfortable. A couple of details have made me downgrade the hotel. Once arriving in a big van by the front parking area lobby (we were a group of 10), we were expecting help to enter lugage into the lobby. Expectations were a dream as we got no assistance at all. Once inside, the reservations made thru a travel agent could not be located by the clerks, so even that we thankfully had the rooms, check in was long and tedious. After a long translatlantic trip with young fellows, what one does not want is a problematic and long procedure to reach the room. To complicate things further, when I asked the reception for a US converter to plug my blackberry, they told me they did not have and all they had were for sale. Being an extensive traveller, I have never experienced such lack of customer care. I have seen both choices; either you leave a deposit and once the adapter is returned, the deposit is refunded or simply a "here you are SIr" and they expect the guest to return upon departure. In such a hotel category, I would expect that a belly boy brings it to the room. All in all, this hotel needs to review their customer service. For me, such "small" details can make a difference when returning to the area. I would probably stay somewhere else for the same price, expecting a more satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: I spent six days at this wonderful hotel during my business trip to Miami. The location is great (there is lots to do in Coconut Grove), their 8th floor pool with jacuzzi and adjacent restaurant and bar is a great work to chill and to work, and the view is just plain stunning. I found all their staff super friendly, in particular Diego at the restaurant, who was very attentive and personable, and Freddie at the Front Desk who really helped me out. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Upscale Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouieD14
Reviews.Content: I stay here at least once a year. The staff from reservations to housekeeping are great. The accomodations are very nice. Rooms may have a mini kitchen or at least a refrigerator. The beds are very comfortable. Pool and workout facilities are great with the pool having a towel service and very responsive bar and food service from Panarama restaurant. The view from the pool deck over Biscayne Bay is awesome. Parking in the area is at a premium. Valet is responsive and helpful. The coconut grove coco walk area with restaurants and shopping is a short walk from the hotel. There is a Fresh Market grocery just down Bayshore drive across from 27th Ave by the Marina area which is walking distance and an awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with my niece.”
Reviews.Author: Maria C
Reviews.Content: I went to breakfast with my niece. We loved the restaurant, excellent service, great view ... I want to thanks to everybody by all attention, in special to Cesar Cadalso .

Reviews.Title: “"Our first time staying and we will be back"”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Sonesta and I must say, we were extreamly pleased with everything. The service and friendliness is very notable. Rooms are vary spaciuos and clean. The view is breath taking and we loved how close it was to Coco Walk. I will be returing in a month to Miami and for sure I will be staying again. Thanks again Sonesta for making our family vacation so plesant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in the Miami/Coconut Grove area. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Steve N
Reviews.Content: All The staff are very helpful and pleasant. Great roof top pool and cafe. Great salads for lunch. The rooms are spacious and have a terrific view of the bay. The gym was wonderful. And there is a great sauna. Walking distance to lovely and diverse restaurants--seafood, indian, italian, etc. And walks along the water-- beautiful marina. Nearby movie theater. Easy taxi rides into downtown Miami and South Beach. Very convinent. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our future base in Miami preceding and following cruises”
Reviews.Author: Pieter B
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel: beautifully appointed rooms with magnificent views, a naturally friendly staff, and the restaurant is an absolute must. Refined and creative menu's with a Peruvian touch, and a warm and welcoming service. Location couldn't be better, at least a neighbourhood in Miami where one can walk around and enjoy drinks or a meal on a terrace, so the car can be left in the hotel garage. Close to the airport and to downtown Miami. We'll be back in February 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to scape,relax and discover Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Monica D
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and discover Miami. Shops, restaurants, entertainment and movies within walking distance. Smooth linens, cozzy beds and pillows. Excellent services. Come and stay at the Sonesta....you are guarantee to be in an excelent place! Thank you so much to Roger Sosa for clarify all billing issues.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Carolina1016
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at The Sonesta in Coconut Grove for many years, since it first opened!! And we stay many times during the year!!! For us, it's the "Best Place to Stay in Miami"!!! For its location, for their rooms, for their staff and for everything that has to do with the Hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and spacious with great views to the City and to the Bay. Some of them even have full kitchens for your convenience. For us, The Sonesta is like our Home in Miami. Everyone there is so nice and helpful that we feel like if we were home!! We highly recommend the Hotel for any type of stay in Miami; close to Shopping Centers, Restaurants, Hospitals, Beaches and anything you need in Miami. Enjoy your stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Food & Beverage Caribbean Bottler Meeting.”
Reviews.Author: lisanchez
Reviews.Content: I coordinated a meeting here and the banquet service was excellent food is great, the banquet staff is very professional, friendly and always helpful, I would like to mentioned to Mr. Omar Aguilar, Mr. Frank Ruiz, Mr. Manuel Prado, Mr. Miguel Prado and Mr. JosÃ© HernÃ¡ndez, also, I would like to give my gratitude for Mr. Joel Lopez and Ms. Johana Flores for your helpful too. We had the same servers for two days and they did a magnificent job in making sure we all had what we needed. Without them, this would have been impossible. Thanks Lisette Sanchez

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: Went for a couples trip to Miami and had to check this place out since we wanted to go to CocoWalk. It was amazing hotel was perfect, Panorama Restaurant in the hotel was absolutely fantastic. Staff was very friendly and accomodating even providing an umbrella since it was a rainy evening. The room was perfect plenty of room for the two of us. We will definitely go back to this hotel it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, always come back to it!”
Reviews.Author: Dede8475
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the only place I stay in when in Miami...strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Smelt gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon Q
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice of hotel....we stayed for two weeks and the quality of service was excellent. The room was modern, the pool was kept immaculately clean and serviced by very friendly attendants, and I dont know what the scent in the reception area was (think something green tea related!) but it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale modern hotel on the bay”
Reviews.Author: blonomad
Reviews.Content: Staff very professional and helpful, especially Security personnel. While I was waiting in the lobby for my husband a security officer stood with me and carried on conversation to keep me company. Our room was equipped with washer and dryer, mini bar but no microwave or fridge as some rooms have. A few amenities are provided such as coffee maker with one free pot per day. If you use more coffee you are charged at mini bar prices for the coffee. Items available for purchase include toothpaste, razor, etc. Beds very plush and comfortable with feather pillows and duvet. Luxury towels. Very clean room with sleek modern decor. Grout in bathroom could use a good scrubbing. Small bedside tables, desk, chair, dresser. No mirror in bedroom, 4 mirrors in bathroom. AC efficient and quiet. Marble, granite, and tile accents. Valet parking only. We used public parking next door at $15 per day as opposed to hotel's $23 valet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience but our issues were quickly sorted out”
Reviews.Author: Shazpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sonesta Bay Hotel in Coconut Grove for a couple of nights mid-September during our three week holiday to Florida. Although the hotel itself is in a great location (close to the town, the sea, lots of restaurants etc nearby) we experienced a few issues whilst there. However, they were all very quickly and smoothly sorted out by the staff following an email to them when we arrived home. The location, although excellent, lets it down a little as there is a VERY noisy bar somewhere near to the hotel. Despite us being on a very high floor and the windows being firmly closed, we heard very loud music and shouting (including some vulgar swearing) into the very early hours of the morning during our stay. Bear in mind that we stayed at the Sonesta on week nights, so I can only imagine that it would be worse on a weekend. However, we informed the staff of this, they were aware and explained to us that this issue was currently in the midst of being resolved with the bar/club owner who would soon be told he couldn't play music so loud. Whether or not that has happened is another question. Also, our air conditioning unit was extremely noisy, so much so that we could not have it on in the night as it would make such loud banging noises, so we had to put up with the heat as it seemed more acceptable than the noise. We did have the engineer come up to our room twice however he did not fix it. The actual hotel itself is beautiful. Our view of the city and bay (our suite was on the corner so we benefited from two views) was absolutely gorgeous and the rooms were clean, tidy, and up to date other than a cupboard door which fell off during our stay! The pool area was lovely and again, had amazing views and would have been much nicer if another unpleasant guest had not thrown his/her cigarette out of their window on to the lounger next to us! Of course, this is not the hotel's fault, however it was concerning, what if there were a child on that chair? Again - the hotel itself is gorgeous and the shortcomings of our stay were resolved very smoothly and we were extremely grateful of the outcome. I would stay here again to give the hotel another chance to impress us as I see its full potential. Don't let these things put you off going but be aware that if the club has not been told to quieten down, you might not have a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at this hotel and we will return again.If you can get a bay view in this hotel it is just gorgeous. To wake up in the morning and walk out onto the balcony and see it is amazing. There are quite a few different styles of rooms and the ones with a kitchen or kitchenette are very nice. There are also standard rooms and one bedroom suites. The desk staff are very good at helping with requests. Bathrooms are small and average. I really like the pool area where the pool staff will bring you ice water or water with cucumber. The hotel feels upscale and is in a good location. Parking is pricey if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: Pampered_Guest1110
Reviews.Content: The Management are to be commended with the excellent job done with the staff as they are very helpful, courteous, friendly and professional. For example, they tirelessly come around to offer lemon ice water to the guests and ensure you have everything you need when at the pool. The Hotel has events to engage the guests, such as a wine tasting night. The rooms are innovative with motion sensor lower lights when your foot comes off the bed to enable you to see without turning on the main light and disturbing your partner. We enjoyed ourselves greatly and look forward to future stays here and will highly recommend the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel to family and friends. Hope you get a chance to experience for the Hotel for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf”
Reviews.Author: Kthorton12
Reviews.Content: Eugene & Sergio take care of you when you check-in. John, Ceasar, Edra and Patrick provide fabulous food and drinks with an unforgettable view!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great bedding too!”
Reviews.Author: mfrancois
Reviews.Content: Feeling at home right in the middle of Coconut Grove - Plus beds are incredible! Luv it -

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Fenbee
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Royal Sonesta Coconut Grove on a mini vacation and found it to be the most amazing experience. Not only is the setting perfect but the entire hotel was also. From the first class staff to the top-notch amenities I could not have asked for anything more. The pool is located in the perfect location to give you the perfect view of paradise and the ultimate relaxation. I would recommend to anyone traveling in South Florida should stay at the Royal Sonesta. Thanks to their superior staff they will make it a five-star experience that you won't be able to wait to do again. But don't take my word for it. Go experience the Royal Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Food service”
Reviews.Author: Israel P
Reviews.Content: Attended a seminar here and the banquet service was excellent. We had the same servers for three days and they did a magnificent job in making sure we all had what we needed. Jose, Frank and Manuel are what service in a luxury hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.........if only it was more central”
Reviews.Author: carolinem1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel 9th-12th September for a shopping weekend with a friend. After a 9hr flight to Miami we were greeted with a lovely spaceous room with two very comfy double beds and a balcony. The rooms are well equipped with cooking facilities, however we never used them as there is a shopping/entertainment centre called CocoGrove mins away by foot. Within the complex there is a Cheesecake Factory (a must - i have never had cheescake so good), Chilli's (like TGI Fridays but nicer) and numerous bars (which sell pina colada slushy - yum). Back the the hotel, the facilties are good - swimming pool clean and nice gym too. Location - as we were only here for a weekend we chose not to hire a car, this was a mistake. Coconut Grove is a little out of the way if your looking for a beach retreat. A trip to the mall in a taxi cost $120 return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vancioffi
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Sonesta. I had a great time! The staff is very helpful and attention. They make the difference! Clean and very space room. The breakfast could have more option as fruits and cheese for brazilians. Parking could be included too. Besides that is amazing! There is a nice pool with a incredible view, fitness place and a sauna. If you want be treat as a special person this is the place you should go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, customer service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Charliethree
Reviews.Content: Just got back to UKÂ following holiday in Miami. My stay at the Sonesta was amazing. The concierge Marco was especiallyÂ helpful and polite.Â  The clealiness of the room and the facilites and ambience of the hotel were perfect.Â  I would recommend the Sonesta to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Large view room”
Reviews.Author: greenbirdOlympia_WA
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our recent stay, room was large, great view from balcony, comfortable bed. Modern somewhat stark furnishings was only reservation, but typical for Miami I suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Coconut Groove”
Reviews.Author: r0cky23
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to chill out, away from the craziness of South Beach. Some nice shops, restaurants and a park within short walking distance. Excellent bay views. Just what you need if you're looking for a place to relax for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel that has fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsBella
Reviews.Content: I arrived back from one of the best holidays in Miami earlier this week, when looking to book hotels I obvioulsy started at the top of trip advisor list and the Sonesta was no 2. I emailed the hotel direct to sort out a package that suited and Elizabeth Dubon emailed me straight back and was so helpful and exceeded my expectations so at this point I could not wait to get there. The hotel is all about service, we were looked after by everyone we came into contact with even staff moving around the hotel are very friendly. We had a bed & breakfast rate and they were amazing so much to choose from the smoked salmon and cream cheese was lovely. The pool area is kept perfectly and Alex was there most days to look after us bringing us iced water to cool off in the Miami heat. The gym is on the top of the hotel and has an amazing view and it has very good equipment for a hotel gym. The sonesta is a perfect location to visit local restaurants, Ludo's italian and Jaguary Ceviche were my favourites and just up the road. There is also a fresh produce supermarket 10 minutes walk away which has some lovely things to try. I will definatley be back to stay here in the future, they have it spot on.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jess926
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel about a month ago and fell in-love with the property. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and the views from the pool were breathtaking. We spent MANY hours at the pool. Chris and Alex were so attentive and friendly. I just couldn't get over how hospitable the staff was at making sure we were comfortable and enjoying our stay. I enjoyed my stay so much that I'm coming back this weekend for my 35th birthday bash! I'm excited to share the experience with my friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel. The hotel is situated in a peaceful area, making it easy to relax en enjoy your vacation. Shopping centre with Starbucks, Cheesecakefactory and Movie Theatre are just around the corner, same as some nice restaurants. The hotelâ€™s services are very customer friendly, employees do their very utmost to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Rooms are nice and clean, pool and gym are great and the restaurant serves great food for a reasonable price. The hotel offers an opportunity to take part of organized trips around Miami and to the Everglades. To visit other areas of Miami transport by taxi can be advised, considering Miami parking rates.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sonesta Hotel. We were running behind schedule, and therefore checked in late. We regret doing that, because the area was very beautiful, as well as the hotel. We were greeted by Freddie at the front desk, and he was a pleasure to speak with. He made every effort to make us feel comfortable and at home. The room we originally had was not suitable, so he upgraded us to an extravagent room, with a breath-taking view. We were so happy, and his attitude showed us that he was genuinely happy for us. Everything was great- from the area to the hotel and the guest service within. It was the best time we my wife and I had away from home in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escapade”
Reviews.Author: DonTutto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a little escapade with my wife while they tented our house for termites. I actually work in Coconut Grove so it was wonderful to actually experience the area as a local. Having the delicious Peacock Garden Cafe next to the hotel was great and walking to work was a treat. The hotel was just perfect. Irlanda at the reception desk was fantastic and accommodated my requests. Thanks to her we stayed in a beautiful suite with fantastic views of the sailboats in the bay. Drinks one evening at Panorama restaurant were fun especially overlooking the bay and Edra (sp?) made us feel at home. Now I have first hand experience why the people we send to the hotel are always so happy to stay there. Oh, and did I mention the great views of the bay?!

Reviews.Title: “excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: vacationer3855
Reviews.Content: We spent a romantic labour day weekend at the Sonesta. We were greeted with and early check in and upgraded to a beautiful suite. The suite was nice and bright, modern and comfortable. Everything was kept up to date in the room. The gym was a good size for a hotel with equipment that actually worked . the views are fantastic. the location is ideal for the grove, Food, movies, entertainment is right there. no car rental needed . the staff really make this hotel. they are very friendly and go out of their way to make you comfortable. can't wait to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Real life fantasy”
Reviews.Author: Harleyguy_76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a wonderland. There are things to do for girls night out ie: shops nearby. Guys night out ie: local bars. Couples night out ie:Paragon theaters which has a bar in the movies and a private screening room. The restaurant at the hotel is the best in Miami. peruvian style cuisine with the beat views Miami has to offer. Our room had a balcony with a perfect view of the water. We loved every minute of our stay from the reservation process all the way tochecking in. The only thing we didn't like was checking out because we didn't want to leave. This has by far been the vacation ever and I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a beautiful view of biscayne bay”
Reviews.Author: crbmw335
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple days in the grove and very much enjoyed our stay at the sonesta hotel. would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: MarcoIslandGirl
Reviews.Content: We went to Coconut Grove for a weekend function at the Coral Reef Yacht Club. Elizabeth, the reservation supervisor, took excellent care of us. We had a beautiful large deluxe city view room with a full kitchen. We were on the 12 floor and also had a very nice view of the Gulf from the balcony. Everything was First Class with granite counters in kitchen and bath. Lovely Gulf view, rooftop pool, bar and restaurant. Excellent 5 star staff. Great location across from Cocowalk and Shops at Mayfair. Also, next to CocoWalk on Grand Ave, is a fun 4.5 star Latin fusion restaurant called "Jaguar Spot". If you enjoy art, you will LOVE THIS SONESTA! The entire building is like an art gallery. You will be provided with a brochure and may take a walking tour through their Art Collection. Quite Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Superb. Will be coming again in November. Thank you all!”
Reviews.Author: Antonio-ASJR
Reviews.Content: Believe all the reviews: this people now how to run a Hotel. Stayed here for 3 days... Amazing! There is nothing fancy about the hotel, but everything is in place: perfect front desk (There is a girl called Daniela that deserves a prize. Whatever you ask or need, is promptly answered), excellent accommodations and a really good location (steps away from CocoWalk - stores, J. Rockets, Starbucks...). Arrived at 7 AM and was directly sent to my room. Perfect. Nice bed, super clean, nice view and truly silent. Slept like a newly born. Room service was also excellent, quick and tasty. Good prices too. There is a parking lot just by the hotel (US 15 per day) which is a good idea. Sergio, who works at the door knows everything about arts and was really helpful. The swim pool has a great view and the restaurant is excellent. I canâ€™t think of a bad thing to say. Will came again and will recommend to everyone I know that is going to Miami. Lovely City. PS: If you want to shop, donâ€™t waste your time at the crowded outlets: Aventura Mall has the same price and it is waaaayyyy better. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service,very friendly and clean environment”
Reviews.Author: Danny G
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at this hotel and I figured it would be pretty boring since it wasn't near the beach at all.However there was plenty of entertainment around the area.The hotel,epecially the room,was very clean.From the moment I arrived till I departed the staff was very polite especially the front desk girl (Daniella) she always gave me directions to everywhere I wanted to go.I had a very pleasant stay and will return next time I visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi M
Reviews.Content: My husband works in the film industry and stays here often (we're from California), he was working in Miami and booked a room here for our anniversary. I have to say it was VERY nice- not just the accomendations but the staff: Mari and her staff at the front desk (Nathan and Tricia) and John the bar manager were just as nice as the hotel. Lovely views, great shopping, and there's a yoga studio (Gharma Studio) close by that has wonderful classes (I went to two).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - relaxing, clean, friendly, and good location!”
Reviews.Author: ncmom_11
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we were very pleased once again. The hotel is well maintained and clean. The staff are friendly and very accomodating. The rooms are nice and have very comfortable beds with some wonderful views (we had a bayfront room). The pool is very nice and the staff there are always seeing if there is anything you need. The gym is very adequate. It is a short walk to Coco Walk which has restaurants, shops, movie theatre. In the other direction from the hotel one can take a nice walk/run near the bay. The free wireless worked without any problems. The one drawback is the parking fee, but this seems to be the norm for the area. The Sonesta will definetly be our home away from home as our daughter is attending college in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a busness conference, as it is a quieter side of the Miami landscape”
Reviews.Author: RAJ51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not inexpensive, but there are a wide range of eating and dining options within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The service was attentive but discreet, the meals were interesting. Security was good with room cards needed to access the accomodation floors of the hotel. Wireless hooked up easily. Though the decor was not as interesting as some of the boutique influenced hotels, it was ok. The standard room was adequate in size, with the bathroom a little more generous.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Elizabeth!!!”
Reviews.Author: miyita
Reviews.Content: Last july we stayed at the sonesta bayfront for the second time in less than six months. this time, we spent two whole weeks. it's a great hotel all around. it's neither fancy pants nor does it dwell on unnecessary luxury, but it's modern with a classic feel to it. very nice and very functional. we occupied a double room, which was convenient, given that we have two girls, aged 6 and 2, and the amount of space they had to run around and play made our time in the room feel like what it was: vacation. And the view. Make sure you ask for a bayfront room. opening the curtains every morning to sail boats moored at the bay and the miami beach skyline in the background was the equivalent of a spa session. the pool is amazing, too. For us it's very important that it shouldn't be cold, and they manage to keep it at a warm temperature that's still refreshing. The size is just right too. And again, the view. The Panorama restaurant by the pool is good, too. I especially recommend the shrimp tempura. Tasty and a bit spicy. The Sonesta staff also makes a difference. Every one of them was kind and helpful. The guys at the pool are always checking if you need something. The waitrasses at Panorama, always welcoming and nice. A special word goes to Elizabeth Dubon, the reservations supervisor. She was outstanding. She understood that, with two small children and arriving at 6 am we needed a room to freshen up and she managed to give us one without having to pay for the night before (because check in time is 3 PM). Moreover, our flight back to buenos aires was postponed from 11:50pm to 8:30 am the next morning, and she let us spend the night at a one bedroom suite for a special low price. It's hard to find staff so sympathetic and kind anywhere. She took a lot of stress out of our experience. We also really like the area. We're steps away from Coco Walk in Coconut Grove, and there are many restaurants around. it's a ten minute drive to Coral Gables and a 15-20 minute drive to South Beach (an area that we really like, but that's not very convenient with two small girls). One piece of advice, though: don't leave your car at the valet parking. There's a much much cheaper parking lot literally next door, and you don't have to wait for the valet to bring your car over (sometimes, when two or more parties are waiting ahead of you, it can take them up to nearly 10 minutes to bring your car). All in all, a great place. We will definitely stay there again the next time we go to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPALLADINO
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by chance and we found it gorgeous.our suite was on the 20 floor and Had an amazing sight. The balconies sere enormous and i' d say quite rare in the Us. It's one of the few hotels i' advise for the nice atmosphere and the helpful and full time present staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lacking somehow”
Reviews.Author: MK2000
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located between the bay and downtown Coconut Grove, The Sonesta is a good choice for vacationing families who don't need the beach and don't want to spring for Ritz Carlton rates. It's walking distance to CocoWalk with national chain restaurants like Cheesecake Factory, Chiles, etc. and many other interesting local shops and eateries. The hotel itself is a little more sterile and unadorned versus the typical luxury brand hotel (e.g. Hyatt). The rooms are perfectly adequate and many have convenient kitchenettes, but the modern decor is rather humdrum. Bathrooms are merely functional. The pool and penthouse exercise room are fine but not the least bit extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kathy G
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is 2 blocks from the bay and I had a great view. Everyone on the staff was very helpful and very friendly, not fake friendly like you get at some places. The food at the hotel was great. The beds incredibly comfortable and the whole hotel was very clean. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: NRRobinson
Reviews.Content: Perfect oasis near Miami. Staff is great. Food is nice. Pool - very clean - not enough chairs ! Room large, clean, clean and bed is confo. Nice view. Decor is really nice (original painting) and I forget to ask about the "Wow" smell in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Donovan F
Reviews.Content: awesome deal for Florida residents, great area, great service, great view...

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chillwilly99
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Great view of bay & Coconut Grove cocowalk area. Service was excellent. Room was comfy, clean, even though on the small side. Panorama restaurant was excellent w/ an even better view of bay. Parking was pricy for my taste but such us life all over MIA...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: epc2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at the Sonesta and everything was perfect , beds are very very comfortable , very clean rooms and excellent views on the Bay view rooms. This is a jewel in Miami , excellent location ,and rates are very reasonable . If you need any help , Elizabeth the manager is very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Farewell Gary”
Reviews.Author: chefsterDoral
Reviews.Content: Came here to pay my respects to a departed friend. Was very happy with the accommodations at Sonesta. Even the air freshener was pleasant! Room 1605-2 was appointed with a kitchen. We thought the in room coffee policy was kind of tight wad but having had a career in the hotel industry I have to give a nod to clever revenue management. Very comfortable bed and linens. Outstanding dinner at Panorama with our server Svetlana? Creative Peruvian inspired seafood dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with this property”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: I checked out today in the morning from this beautiful property ,it is amazing how good I felt during my stay , my trip from my hometown was not good at all , my flight got cancelled twice , you can imagine how frustrated I arrived to your hotel , but since the moment I arrived my door was opened immediately by one manager who just happened to be there , she asked me right there how was my trip I mentioned my situation and she escorted me to the front desk introducing herself as Mary Moyo and she stayed at the desk talking to me while her front desk was checking the reservation , during my conversation I told her that I was running late for my meeting and that I was dying for a cup of coffe to get the energy back and be ready for my meeting , she stepped out from the desk and while I was going to the elevator she was just there waiting for me with that coffee, wooooowwwww I was amazed about that , same day when I arrived to my room I saw a note from her hoping my meetings went well again wow another plus , today while I was checking out she was there again , I was telling her that I didnt even have the time to go shopping to get something for my husband and my baby and asked me the time my flight was leaving , I told her that I needed to be by 3pm , she went to the back and got a Coconut Grove map where she mentioned me some stores where I can get something before I leave , I was very into my business that I didnt know the stores were so close .....well I only want to share this situation to tell how good I felt on this property and I promised her I will be back soon for vacation eventhough is not on the beach , EXCELLENT SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: antonio n
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Everything about it is consistently good. Elizabeth Dubon always goes out of her way to help our family have a pleasant stay. It is good to see that Margaret Rose is back in management, she did a terrific job at Sonesta Key Biscayne were our family stayed during our summer vacations. We stay at the Sonesta every time we are in Miami for fun or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location: GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Kita27
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I went to Miami for some shopping and leisure. I made quite a research on where to stay: we wanted a good hotel near to shops and restaurants, in a safe area, so we wouldn't have to drive out to eat every night. Sonesta was absolutely perfect!!! The hotel is beautiful (including some great art works everywhere - and the most amazing pout-pourri scent in the lobby), the view is breathtaking (including a marina, Key Biscayne and some huge green areas), the staff is super nice, competent and willing to help. We got a great deal, loved the room. There was wifi with good speed, parking for a reasonable price and pleasant staff, swimming pool, good restaurant (we loved the breakfast and the staff was the BEST!!! Aura, Sonia, Humberto and all, thank you so much!!). The location: this is Coconut Grove, baby! It is great! The ambiance is great, with goodlooking people everywhere. There is Gap, Victoria's Secret, Ann Taylor, CVS Pharmacy etc steps away. The area is known as the food court of Miami with lots of restaurants of all kinds. You take literally 2 mins to get to them. Go to the Cheesecake Factory and if you don't get to the cheesecake itself, take a slice back to the hotel with you! There are also some great bars nearby. Besides that, the hotel is minutes away from Dadeland Mall, Merrick Park (5 min, beautiful mall) and so many other facilities I could not name it here. It took us 20/30 min to get ANYWHERE in Miami (Aventura, Bal Harbour, Miami Beach). It is close to the airport (less than $20 by taxi if you get Le Jeune Rd!). Hope I said enough. Can't wait to go back there! Warmest regards, Maria

Reviews.Title: “Coconut grove Paradise”
Reviews.Author: fernandoarce
Reviews.Content: came into miami for a business trip. did not really know where i wanted to stay. i picked coconut grove for its restaurants and shops. 1st i went to see what Mutiny Hotel had to offer, but it was sold out. So i chose Sonesta Hotel. WOW they were almost sold out too. I got a room for a reasonable price of about $150 a nite. $20 for car garage indoor. The hotel is 4 star and i was very impressed with the valet, lobby, front desk, room, pool, restaurant and over all service. I highly recommend it and will return soon! shout of to Alex from the roof top pool. nice guy

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite!!!”
Reviews.Author: tabascomom
Reviews.Content: We just made reservations for Christmas for 2011! The last four trips this past year were wonderful! The Hotel is fabulous and beautiful! Everyone is terrific!!! Reservations always gets it right, all of our whims are remembered. Alex, at the pool, was so helpful for some special needs that we had. It is always a pleasure to arrive and be greeted as if we are family every time! Although it is August we can't wait to return to the Sonesta in Coconut grove for Christmas! it is also soooo close to restaurants, shops, and easy to get around the area. Our Favorite !!!! !

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: JRC54
Reviews.Content: We held our Latin America Distributor meeting at the hotel and was very impressed by the professionalism, customer care and attention to detail of all the staff. From the reception to the staff that assisted during our meeting. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Regret only staying two nights”
Reviews.Author: gordonsilverbirch
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel relatively close to the airport that we could unwind in after a flight from Scotland and this fitted the bill. We found the Hotel easily from the airport ( although we did get lost in the airport itself!!!). Room was very comfy and breakfast was superb. We chose to eat outside on the terrace despite the heat/humidity. Staff were always on the go cleaning and generally checking up that everything was in order We were on a trip for our wedding anniversary and this was the cheapest hotel we stayed in but was probably our favourite and by far the best value for money. Our only regret was not staying longer. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: peterp_belgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in April for a little over a week. The rooms are a decent size and there is a kitchennette. The best part of the hotel is the pool/breakfast area which is somewhere on the 12th floor and offers a breathtaking view of the ocean and coconut grove area. Freidnly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Ardnassz
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, an affordable price for real quality. Beautiful view. Stores of all kinds nearby, good location, bus or taxis always available. You can have breakfast at the hotel's restaurant for 20-30 dollars or go nearby (starb) and have it for 10. I would definitely recomend this place. If you want breakfast in your room remember to ask for it the night before. If you want to know Miami but save money, look for metrobus route 246 at www.miamidade.gov/transit The fare is 25 cents and it takes you to the nearest metrorail station where you can get a 7 day pass for 28 dollars......a bargain...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great people”
Reviews.Author: Jane20EH
Reviews.Content: Sonesta Bayfront Hotel was a great hotel to stay in. The room was lovely, the view was fantastic and the service couldn't be faulted. The breakfast menu was extensive and on the occasions when I dined in the restaurant the food was excellent. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly Chris and Alex the pool attendants and Sonia in the restaurant. The area of Coconut Grove housed many delightful shops and restaurants within walking distance and I would definitely return to this area and hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No bathtub”
Reviews.Author: UplandTravelor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, it was very comfortable but there was no bathtub. I called upon entering and was told there were no bathtubs. My daughter-in-law had booked the room and thought she had booked a suite and was surprised to see only one room. But she wasn't aware there was no bathtub as they had a large suite. I looked forward during the 3 nights at this hotel to the suite on the ship with a bathtub as I took "spit baths" out of the basin for 3 nights. Also ice was only available on one floor so a trip had to be taken every time ice was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: Nery95
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ocean view. Near a beautiful park and Cocowalk shopping. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: gigi33133
Reviews.Content: I stay here often and refer all of my friends and family and we have never been disappointed. Even the deluxe rooms are spacious and comfortable and offer a descent view. It's so nice to have a clean, spacious full kitchen featuring a full-size refrigerator and freezer, microwave, and every convenience one can think of! The balconies are large enough for two chairs and a table and offer beautiful views of either the bay or the "city". The bedding is so luxurious and makes it difficult to get out of it and enjoy the rest of what the hotel and surrounding area have to offer. The attention to detail and in-room amenities are very impressive and much appreciated. I had the opportunity to work out in the fitness room which was better outfitted than any other hotel of its calibur. It is obviously very well maintained and in the women's spa there is a steam room and sauna - what a treat! I can't say enough about the pool deck. I can't imagine having any better view than that of Biscayne Bay, the sailboats, and the sunrise. The service around the pool during the day was very attentive yet not overbearing. The employees work very hard in the heat making sure that guests have everything they need to enjoy their experience. One of the pool attendants, Alex, was especially helpful. I ordered lunch at the pool and thought it was very refreshing and delicious - and generous by hotel standards! The pool itself is beautiful and gives the feeling and appearance of an infinity pool when you are in it. There is also a good-sized jacuzzi and cabanas off to the side for a proper lunch or dinner table setting. We also received very good service from the bartender Patrick - who quickly attended to our coctail needs. Did I mention the location? The best! You can walk just about anywhere in the Grove from the hotel - shopping, restaurants, clubs, movie theater, parks, etc... Needless to say, from check-in until check out, the Sonesta Coconut Grove provided a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: pairodise
Reviews.Content: The pool is small and was crowded during our stay; the hot tub was filthy. It took at least 20 minutes for drinks (JUST DRINKS) and longer for food. The room was nothing spectacular... unless you are really impressed with a simple flat screen TV. The water pressure was terrible. The only thing this Hotel has going for it is location.... if you would prefer to walk the strip and stay the night. Otherwise, my two day stay totaling $550 was NOT worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Sonesta is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: chococoffee
Reviews.Content: Awesome views, excellent customer service and great location - all three reasons make the Sonesta at Coconut Grove a hotel that provides a unique experience for all types of travel, business or pleasure. Staff is professional and friendly, rooms are spacious and spotless and the pool is open from dawn to dusk! What else can you possibly need? I would add the amazing room fragrance at the lobby, a blend of lemongrass and green tea infused in the air-condition system... Sonesta is definitely a hotel to visit not only once, but definitely twice!

Reviews.Title: “SONESTA BAYFRONT IN COCONUT GROVE WAS AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: rao1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on saturday July16,2011 My girlfrined and i just walked up and requested a room with no reservation and the staff was extremely helpful and provided a bayview room on the 16 floor.the first thing we noticed was how clean the lobby is and how well maintained this hotel is.The room was spacious and the staff very professional.The pool on the 9th floor added a nice touch and the drinks/food was very enjoyable.IF YOUR EVER IN THE AREA YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED.ASK FOR EUGENE,I BELIEVE HES THE MANAGER AND WHO WAS HANDS ON WITH A WONDERFUL DEMEANER THAT MADE US FEEL SPECIAL.HE EVEN THREW IN THE VALET PARKING FOR NO CHARGE AND PROVIDED AN AWESOME ROOM 1616 WITH AN ATTRACTIVE RATE.I WILL BE BACK.WE EVEN RECEIVED A 3:00PM LATE CHECK-OUT.HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: pamuc
Reviews.Content: Pro: *hotel and rooms are clean and nice *located near Coconut Grove, lots of nice Restaurants nearby *nice view *early checkin and late checkout Cons: *We made three additional requests (we booked a Palm Suite) - none of them was accomplished: -high floor (we ended up in the second lowest floor) -quiet room (we had a double door to the next room/suite - you could hear every word from the neighbor room) -crib for a 2 year old (we got a tiny baby crib, two hours later on the phone and only after announcing our checkout, the hotel could find a solution) *Wifi is tricky if reception is spelling your surname wrong (spent another 30 minutes with their outsourced help desk) *Check your bill! The promised free parking was listed there.

Reviews.Title: “Perect hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Fsandon
Reviews.Content: Very helpful, polite staff. Immaculately kept hotel. Convenient to shopping and restaurants. Gorgeous views of the water! Super comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: kinto1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very confortable and very clean. The views of the bay were fantastic. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel. We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: dosentplay
Reviews.Content: My family and a close family friend spent four days at the Sonesta in coconut grove for the fourth of July. we had a two bedroom suite which overlooked Biscayne Bay and Peacock park. The staff at the hotel were all so nice and took care of whatever we needed. The rooms were roomy, very classy and comfortable. The suite also had a full kitchen. A very classy and upscale resort, but not pretentious. There is a great pool on the 8th floor, also overlooking the bay. We watched the fireworks from the huge balcony of our room. It was like we could reach out and touch them. There is ample shopping and dining close by (walking distance) . There is a decent gym on the roof of the hotel with glass windows with a view of the highrises of downtown Miami. it is about 3 miles away. I would reccomend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and will continue to visit”
Reviews.Author: sxmone
Reviews.Content: Always very helpful staff, especially Nicole Loo at the front desk. Great service, excellent location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeyRahman
Reviews.Content: Travelling from London, England with my partner I was eagely anticipating what would greet us when we arrived at Sonesta. We need not have worried. The hotel is situated in a beautiful location within Coconut Grove. Everybody from the front desk staff, the bellmen and the housekeeping were very helpful at all times. Our room was upgraded upon arrival and again it was a very pleasant suprise. The huge deluxe bed was luxurious giving us a perfect night's sleep. The open plan kitchen with utilities and appliances also were very useful to us on the evenings where we fancied a "home cooked meal". The location itself in Coconut Grove is impressive in itself. Everything from bars, restaurants and shopping is within walking distance. Obviously Cocowalk is a huge attraction where you will find anything from Gap, Cheesecake Factory, Hooters and Fat Tuesdays to name a few. This area of Coconut Grove is extremely safe at night if you fancy a stroll in the evening. We encountered no trouble or bother at all. To sum up, our experience of Sonesta and Coconut Grove was a great and relaxing one. We anticipate our return at some point in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “A date to remember”
Reviews.Author: Reinarms
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great. I met a friend for a first date. I spoke with Elizabeth Dubin in reservations. She assisted me as this was a first date I was traveling for. She made me feel comfortable with safety of the hotel and area.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the Grove!”
Reviews.Author: lsaravia
Reviews.Content: â€œA Jewel in the Grove!â€� The Sonesta Bayfront Hotel turned a 1-night weekend getaway into a 6-day, 5-night family vacation! From the moment we drove into Valet parking we immediately felt that we were in good hands. The Valet staff was quick, friendly, and efficient. The Bellmen were also very friendly and quick to assist us with our luggage; no small task for since we are a family of 5. Once we started walking up the steps into the Lobby my sense of smell was totally stimulated. The first thing that I thought was, â€œWow, it smells great in here! What is that? I want it in my house!â€� The Lobbyâ€™s pristine image and modern-style dÃ©cor does not disappoint. It ranged from vibrant wall to wall paintings, and oversized leather sofas to minimalistic glass reservoirs with rock crystals and flowers. The lobby said â€œIâ€™m chic, full of style, modern but not eclectic, and you can call me home as long as you are hereâ€�. The lighting is ideal, and in the evenings the lights are dimmed and candles are lit making the ambiance magical and romantic. As we approached the Front Desk we were continuously greeted by every staff member that walked by us. At the Front Desk my check-in process was also speedy. The suite was ideal for us. It was open and spacious, well decorated but not cluttered. Each bedroom had a large flat screen TV, the living room as well. No one fought for the remote! We were accommodated on the 19th floor, with a beautiful 2-bed, 2 Â½ bath, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, wrap around balcony, with a gorgeous view of the bay, suite. Every day during our stay I woke up to the view of the horizon sky meeting the ocean. The view alone set the tone for my entire day. With the full cooperation of the staff I was able to fully relax and enjoy this impromptu vacation. My children enjoyed swimming and frolicking in the pool. The pool is located on the eighth floor with another great view of the ocean. At times my hubby would go to the pool with our older children while I watched them play and swim from our balcony; as I stayed in the suite with our 1 Â½ year old. On our last night as the sun went down, and while the children swam the sunset away. We were able to enjoy a pool-side appetizer from the Peruvian infused cuisine at the restaurant. Needless to say at 10:30pm I was still hungry for more! The Panorama Restaurant was ready and able to provide us with more of their tantalizing cuisine as late as 11:00pm at night. However, we decided to pass and instead plan a special trip to dine at the restaurant. My husband really took the time to enjoy the Gym located on the PH floor. The city-view from the Gym, along with the chance to watch the sun rise helped him get energized for the day. He was there at 6:15am and back again at 8:30pm. He ate, slept, exercised, and enjoyed the amenities to the fullest. Through it all, our housekeeper was fabulous. As the days went by she anticipated our needs to the degree where I just didnâ€™t need to ask for anything. Upon her regularly scheduled chores she found the time to cater to our family life by bringing us more bath towels, more kitchen towels, if I was asleep she would tend to all else without even waking me up. I would sometimes catch her on her way out of the suite. She was absolutely wonderful and very sweet! The proximity of the hotel to the retail shops and restaurants in and around Cocowalk was such a great benefit for us. In the evenings after dinner we would take a stroll to Cocowalk, or sometimes go out for dinner. The concept of walking to a restaurant was fun for us! A highlight for me was having a Starbucks Coffee Shop within a 5 minute walking distance! I must mention that the superb hospitality and outstanding experience began over the phone as I made our reservations. I called with a 24 hour notice, to book a 1-night stay, and within 4 hours our plans changed and our stay changed to 4-nights. Furthermore, once I was there we just couldnâ€™t part and extended our stay to 5-nights. I cannot recall the names of every staff member that made our stay unforgettable. But here are some for your reference: Reservations: Elizabeth Dubon and Karen (girl from C.A.) Front Desk: Nathan, Nicole Loo, Irlanda, Cassidy, and Adrian Bellman: Gustavo Panorama Restaurant: Svetlana Housekeeper: Rosa (maybe) I didnâ€™t catch her name since I was always handling the children or asleep :) Pool Boy: Alex, a very helpful, friendly, and patient young man. Valet Parking: They were fast and efficient. I didnâ€™t catch their names either. FYI: Overnight parking is $23 per night. Overall, our stay-at-home vacation (because we are Miami residents) was one of the best vacations we have taken. As parents we were able to enjoy our children and fully relax at the same time. We strongly recommend this hotel and would return for another extended stay. Thank you Sonesta and all your staff for giving us an overflowing amount of your sunshine and hospitality during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. The highlight of our trip. We will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: JeanSEEngland
