Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked into this hotel for four days at the beginning of our Silver Wedding trip. From the moment we booked in we knew we were in for a fabulous time. We had been upgraded to a suite which was like a small apartment. I almost moved in permanently. The large living/dining room was beautifully furnished and decorated and the open plan kitchen was well stocked. The views from the sliding doors which led out onto the balcony were of the city of Miami. There was a powder room off the living room which had a washing machine and tumble dryer housed in a cupboard. Through into the large bedroom (with a very large and comfortable bed) revealed breathtaking views of Biscayne Bay through the sliding doors and out onto the wrap around balcony on one side and the sliding doors out onto the balcony city side. Then walk in closet was well stocked with hangars and housed a safe and ironing board and iron. The shower room was well stocked with quality toiletries and large fluffy white towels. Everywhere was spotlessly clean and fresh. There was a large television in the living room and bedroom and free wifi connection which enabled us to keep in touch with everyone 'back home', and research the local area. The complementary champagne and chocolate strawberries were much appreciated on arrival after a long flight. The pool bar and restaurant area on the 7th floor was comfortable and cool with a nice breeze and the sun loungers had lovely squashy cushions. The staff are helpful and friendly and give the impression that they are seriously interested in you having a good time and interested in you. The Peruvian food is delicious. The public areas are bright and furnished with individual art work which even if not to your taste is a great talking point. The staff from the bell boys, the bar staff the reception staff, the young man who dealt with the towels, the chambermaid and the chaps who parked the car were helpful,pleasant, friendly and remembered your name. Special thanks must go to Elizabeth Dubon who went above and beyond to ensure we had a great time. When asked if there was anything we needed, we asked if it was possible to have a kettle in order to boil water for tea as we were using a saucepan and within an hour a hob kettle arrived. Someone had been out to buy it! We enjoyed our stay so much we booked a day visit after our cruise before flying home and there was the kettle. Coconut Grove is a lovely area with lots of bars and restaurants and a marina. It is out of the main bustle of Miami and very pretty. We discovered a fresh food market near the hotel and the produce was wonderful so I was also able to indulge my love of cooking. A drive down to the Keys is well worthwhile but use a sat nav. Seaquarium is also well worth a visit but prepared to be soaked, especially if you are close and are presented with a flower by a dolphin. we enjoyed our nine day cruise but really looked forward to going back to the Sonesta even though it was just for a day. We had to leave all too soon and wish we could have stayed longer. We have stayed in 2 other Sonesta hotels and thought the Sonesta St George in Luxor could not be bettered but this hotel did better that in spades. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very nice”
Reviews.Author: striderhine
Reviews.Content: First and foremost as soon as you walk in you are greeted with a warm welcome at the front desk with the friendliest staff..2nd the hotel itself is very easy to navigate in and around the city itself and 3 it was so awesome that i was upgraded to a nice room with a kitchen and as for those 3 things I'm very pleased with the staff thank you Eugine Birgen and Irlanda garcia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business and pleasure acomodations”
Reviews.Author: FelipeAlbo
Reviews.Content: I was in Sonesta for a three days conference. The meeting rooms, IT connections, restaurant and snack had a high quality standard. On the other hand, the services like front desk, maintenance and back office was very kind and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: smripley
Reviews.Content: Great location in Coconut Grove. I stay here for business, and recently had a complication with two reservations. To make a long story short, the Staff was very eager to resolve the problem, minimize the inconvenience and I genuinely feel they actually care. Regardless of the industry, this type of feeling is hard to come by these days and knowing it still does exist should make your decision very easy if you are looking to stay at the Sonesta. I would like to personally thank Elizabeth Margaret! Thank you again! Sean

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, super friendly employes and fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: trakker108
Reviews.Content: - try the breakfast after a little swim in the rooftop(actually on 8 floor) - jacuzzi with a pina-colada at 6 pm - nothing to say about the room and it is a compliment for a business try when you remember only the negative aspects. - get a late check-out with a smile at the reception - try the ceviche of the jaguar 1 block away - promise yourself to come back !

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: fritzriga
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove is an elegant hotel in a great setting. It has views of lovely Sailboat Bay and is less than a block from the lively village of Coconut Grove. The area within a short walk offers many restaurants and shops, movie theatres, and beautiful parks and tropical gardens. The service in the hotel is excellent; the staff are extremely courteous and friendly. The restaurant in the hotel offers delicious food at very reasonable prices. The outdoor pool is on the eighth floor with magnificent views. Many (if not all) of the rooms have kitchen areas, including minimally a sink and microwave oven. All in all, the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove is our favorite hotel for relaxation and fun. We especially enjoy waking up in a bay view room, walking along the marina, swimming and sunning, and strolling through Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, view, room, amenities and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Floridagirl98
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in the heart of Coconut Grove is absolutely perfect. You can walk to a myriad of stores and restaurants and are right next to biscayne bay, with almost all rooms having a view of the gorgeous bay, the sailboats, Key Biscayne and downtown Miami. The decor of the hotel and the rooms are so much nicer and classier than any of the other hotels in the area. The employees are incredibly friendly and provide excellent customer service. The 8th floor pool is fantastic with one of the best views of Biscayne Bay and Miami that I've ever seen, and I grew up there! There is also a very complete gym on the top level of the hotel that also has incredible views of Miami, Coconut Grove, Coral Gables and Biscayne Bay. Overall, this hotel is superb and is always my first choice of places to stay when I visit Miami for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Service”
Reviews.Author: jmcboca
Reviews.Content: A last minute getaway for Fathers Day weekend was terrific. The hotel is located one block from the center of just about everything in Coconut Grove. The service really was exceptional, led by an unassuming young man, Alex Dubon, at the eighth floor pool that overlooks the bay. From the moment we entered his domain to the minute we left he watched like an eagle to make sure everyone was comfortable. Valet, front desk and room staff treated us kindly. Would go back often!

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Miami”
Reviews.Author: mojitomel
Reviews.Content: Everything was the best, as always. We have been coming down for years. I do not like to stay anywhere else in Miami. Everyone is very nice and helpful. It is nice to see the same people there, that I have seen for years. That say something about the Sonesta! We are coming down Sept.15th....and we can't wait. May come for a weekend in August. Special thanks to Elizabeth in reservations, she is amazing........

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return!”
Reviews.Author: LadyVCole
Reviews.Content: From the moment the bellman opened the door, the service was impeccable. Check-in was simple as was asking for a late check-out becuase of our evening flight. Only positive things can be said about our experience and I would caution anyone who gives this hotel a bad review. We had reservations at Sofitel Miami and cancelled them after walking in the front door - no one helped us, the place looked untidy and service there was awful. Sonesta Bayfront is located in a great area - lots of shops, restaurants, etc.- while also being accessible to Miami Beach, Coral Gables, and even those who want to drive to Fort Lauderdale will find it easy to map. Definitely 4 stars for our visit... we look forward to our next trip to Miami!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay”
Reviews.Author: bschuster23
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sonesta Bayfront for a conference. Easy to get to from 95. I flew in from Fort Lauderdale Airport. Check in was fast and valet parking was $23 a day and they were quick to get my car. The hotel is close to plenty of places to shop, eat and drink. The hotel bar on the 8th floor looked nice but I did not have anything to eat or drink at the hotel bar. The pool was great and the pool area was clean with plenty of lounge chairs. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Internet was free and worked well in my room. A waiter in the pool area went out of his way to get me a towel. The room had a range, coffee maker and full fridge.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL -- THE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: geminitraveler1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is to be avoided; as the rooms are 1/2 the size as pictured on the website. the serviuce is horrible!!! The front desk person was rude and unprofessional. ...ROOMS NOT WORTH MORE THAN $100 / NIGHT! IF YOU ARE USED TO 5 STAR OR A REAL 4 STAR HOTEL ...LOOK ELSEWHERE -- DON'T EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME!!! Clean baths -- Hotel is a good 3 STAR -- AT BEST! PARKING IS THE WORST $23 /NIGHT -- Try the Mayfair across the streetr! -- BETTER YET; The Ritz Carlton a few blocks down

Reviews.Title: “If only I lived here”
Reviews.Author: Frontseatdriver
Reviews.Content: I would like to move into the Sonesta and live there forever. I would spend my mornings on my lovely balcony overlooking the bay, and the evening splashing in the beautiful pool. In between, Iâ€™d enjoy my wonderful bed, fabulous staff, perfect location, excellent food, as well as a mojito or two. But if I were going to live there forever I would have to make a few changes. I would need, for instance, a better wifi connection. I would also need another towel bar in the washroom, 'cus the current single shelf/rack is simply not enough. I would also ask that I not be charged for the tiny booze bottles I did not touch â€“ though that was rectified without question. Even without these changes itâ€™s a still a fabulous hotel. Cooly stylish, yet comfortable. Spacious, yet intimate - courtesy of an engaging and professional staff. Clean, inviting, and perfectly located. Itâ€™s highly unlikely that I will ever live there, but I will definitely stay again when I return to Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “we had a wonderful time at the sonesta”
Reviews.Author: audreycabarete
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at the Sonesta hotel. The room was beautiful, clean, smell fresh, the bed was super confortable (I am an athlete and need good sleep!). We had a room with amazing ocean view on the marina and the sonesta pool and outdoor amazing restaurant. So nice when the lights turn on at night. The outside jacuzzi over viewing the ocean is definitely the best! The staff is super friendly and helpful. I love the valet service, just used it for our entire time there. Once you there, you hardly need you car. The hotel is located at a top spot: 2 minutes walking distance from delicious restaurants, bars and shopping area. If you like to run (I do), just walk out of the hotel and you can run for miles. There is also a park close by where you can do all your outside workout. I definitely recommend the Sonesta in Coconut Groove.

Reviews.Title: “IÂ´m always back since 2009”
Reviews.Author: Anuskave
Reviews.Content: I use the hotel for the proximity to my workplace but at the same time for its excellent location: shops, restaurants, many places to go at a walking distance. Also a great place for your daily exercise. Another reason is that as a woman travelling alone I feel secure and well cared for the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kbnsb
Reviews.Content: This is our third girls trip to Coconut Grove in the past 2 years and once again the Sonesta was awesome. From the size of the room, the amazing view of the bay from the balcony (we could sit there forever), to the convenience of walking to all the shops and restaurants. The staff is extremely professional. We particularly want to thank Roberto and the gentlemen who takes care of the pool area. He was so attentive and helpful - anticipating everything we needed by the pool before we even thought to ask for something. Sonesta is now our "apartment in the Grove" for getaways. We grew up in Florida but its nice to spend time away from home and all the responsiblies and let someone else take care of you!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: dchipon
Reviews.Content: clean, modern large apartment type rooms, with views to the bay & city of miami, great service and nice pool deck & restaurant with views

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and of course we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Fbenitez
Reviews.Content: Location, Amenities and Service, all around excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel value, great location...staff could have been friendlier”
Reviews.Author: AKShah84
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and the Coconut Grove location! The pool was exactly what I was looking for in Miami...I prefered the beautiful bayfront view to the South Beach view. We unknowingly came to Miami during "Urban Beach Week" on Memorial Day weekend and the South Beach area wasn't my cup of tea because of the rowdy crowd - I did not feel safe near the Ocean Drive area, even with my husband right next to me so please plan with caution if you are scheduling a family/couples beach vacation during this event in the future! Other than that, the hotel and Coconut grove itself were a wonderful long weekend getaway...plenty to do and plenty of local restaurants, bars, and delicious yogurt shops nearby. Rooms were nice, maid service was terrific, and though one or two folks among the lobby staff could have been more welcoming, our stay was a very nice and romantic one. Laying out by the pool was extremely relaxing and exactly what I needed for a few days. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boodkins
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 5 nights at the Sonesta Bayfront. The staff was very friendly and corteous, the lobby and room were VERY clean and well maintained. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The kitchen had full size fridge, stove, sink, dish washer, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, can opener. It had utensils, plates, glasses, dish soap, sponge, a skillet. The Free WiFi worked with no problem. One block walk to Coco walk. I definitely recommend staying in this hotel. I recommend dining at Jaguar (Peruvian), Green Street cafe and Le Bouchon (French). There is a self parking lot next door for $15/night.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff, period.”
Reviews.Author: memfu03
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I spend three nights at the Sonesta, and I did not want to leave! From the moment I walked in until the moment I got into a taxi to go to the airport, I received the friendliest, most personalized service. Sonesta must be a great place to work.....otherwise how could the staff stay so friendly?? I think the beds are made of clouds, by the way. My room was always clean when I came back from my work day, and the room in general was modern and comfortable. If you are doing business in the area, you can't find a better location, either. When I was off in the evenings I could walk less than a block to Coconut Walk or the Grove to shop at the eclectic boutiques or eat at any of the many local restaurants. The area is safe and inviting, and my room had a wrap-around view of the bay. Be sure to check out the fitness center, even if you don't like working out. The panoramic view will make you want to get on the treadmill. The pool offers the same sort of view, and the water temperature is always on target. Quite simply--Stay at the Sonesta!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service, good room service and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: StoriesMyNanaTells
Reviews.Content: Coming from Australia, I had arranged to meet three different business people in Miami and found the location made it easy to find. Room service was excellent and there was excellent dining within a block or so of the Hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only hiccup was not getting a good connect to the WiFi in my room but a LAN cable was provided and there were no other issues. The room was lovely, clean and the rate excellent. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LFVS
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta Bayfront is a very beautiful hotel, good location(close to Cocowalk), good service, beatiful ocean view, peruvian food and personnel helpful(front desk, belboy and valet parking). I have to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: carolannsmith60561
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Miami week of May 9 and asked my client where to stay. They suggested the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel. It is very clean and sleek lobby and well appointed rooms. Very helpful staff at all times of day. Marco de the Guarda helped me on my final exit to get a taxi and on my way to the airport. As a woman traveling alone, I always look for special touches and safety and cleanliness. Also convenience and room service. This place has it all! A definite recommend. C Smith

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, staff is very welcoming and remember our names from past visits!!!”
Reviews.Author: yclaw5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sonesta various times, we absolutely love the location, the rooms are always clean, staff extremely courteous. We are greeted by name at the front desk when we walk in, and by different personel!! Very impressive. Could not think of a greater hotel for the money!!!! LOVE THIS PLACE, our home away from home!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the apartments facing the harbor...”
Reviews.Author: Jabiraca
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this hotel at the Palm Suite facing the habour. Great stay. Very close to the Fresh Market and Coral Reef Yacht Club! We will be back this years. The only poor part is the gym which is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you like loud music in the hotel in the night until 3 am coming from the neighbouring bars”
Reviews.Author: jenniferwestgeest
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very noisy (especially on the West and South side of the hotel). If you want to get a good night sleep, do not choose this hotel. The music and dj's from neighbar bars/restaurants make a lot of noise especially between midnight and 3 am. From Thursday to Sunday it is a party here. It is no problem if you are part of the party scene. Hotel offers ear plugs if you complaint. Also some guest take their dog with them in a bag, while pets are not allowed in hotel. Rooms are overpriced, if you want to stay here, wait for a special price. Positive: The beds are comfortable & the service is very good

Reviews.Title: “Personal Attention is Key - and That Key Fits Here”
Reviews.Author: roadsterangel
Reviews.Content: I traveled for business and stayed at the Sonesta in Coconut Grove. The location was perfect, just a block down from the popular Cocoa Walk, and I felt very secure coming and going as a single female. The valet, front desk, security, etc always had a smile and made sure that my trip was good. I had a great sized room that overlooked part of coconut grove and the bay ... nice little balcony ... and even a kitchen for some of my own favorite foods. As a side note, to prep for my visit, and because I needed some additional assistance, I worked with Elizabeth D and she was fantastic in setting up my stay. Not only was she available to answer questions and help before my stay, but she even emailed me my bill so that I could electronically submit it for expenses afterwards. When I came back and stayed the following week, she helped me to get a great room at the last minute. Whenever I travel, personal attention, cleanliness, location and price are important - this hotel hit all marks.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: rmcdouga23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - a little expensive (IMO), but generally worth it. My wife stayed with me while I was in town on business. The staff were great. Particularly great were the breakfast staff in the restaurant and the pool staff - especially Alex. They couldn't do enough for us. The view from the pool is breath-taking and the hotel conveniently located near a large number of excellent restaurants (although, again, a little on the expensive side).

Reviews.Title: “Feels like my own condo”
Reviews.Author: aasRioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel at least 8 times, maybe more. Everytime it was a very pleasurable experience. We like the Biscayne suites on the 17 line, city view, because they have bathrooms with a big window', allowing a lot of natural light, and we still have a beautifull bay view.They always accomodate our request for suites at this line.It's also a good thing that lots of people from the staff have been working there for a long time, so they call us by our names, and it feels very nice

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: FAoki
Reviews.Content: I stay at Sonesta quite often, I like the location - it is walking distance to CocoWalk, restaurants, Fresh Market. The view is gourgeous, food is excellent! Lobby is inviting, smells so good! Rooms are nice ad clean. But what I like most is the service, they are very much customer oriented, very friendly and discret. I have to update my reservations very often and they have always been taken care very quickly, as I needed, just perfect. Thanks to Mrs. Dubon!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Carolina1016
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta in Coconut Grove is always the best place to stay in Miami. It has an excellent location, close to everything; business (Brickell, Coral Gables, Downtown Miami), shopping (Coral Gables, South Miami), leisure (Coconut Grove, Key Biscayne, South Beach) and everything else you need. It is an extremely clean Hotel with excellent service. The rooms are simple, modern and when you need, you can have your full kitchen, when traveling with kids. The beds are very comfortable with down comforters and cotton sheets. The Restaurant is very good and has excellent views of Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BVargas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice in the past three years. We are always welcomed with a smile and recognized as repeat clients. The rooms are gorgeous, clean and well equipped. The staff is always polite and quick to please. We like the walkable environment at Coconut Grove and the commercial mix. The suite with kitchen is a best value. For breakfast at the Hotel, my youngest teen son says the Eggs Benedict with the Peruvian chorizo are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Grove”
Reviews.Author: ARH00991
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly staff, especially at the restaurant and pool. Fantastic views of the bay and right next to all that coco Grive has to offer. Elizabeth D. in reservations very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: nvk1973
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't quite as 4-star as the website and reviews made it seem. It's nice enough. The floor to ceiling windows are great, and the views from the wrap around balcony are great (although with only two uncomfy chairs out there, it's could be nicer.) They certainly nickel and dime you. Rollaway bed, $35/night. Valet parking, $23/a day and it still takes 15 min for them to get it for you. The pool is lovely, although the poolside service was not really there and it's a bit windy on the 8th floor. But most importantly, DO NOT STAY on a low floor or on the side that faces the main Coconut Grove area. It's so loud at night, we might as well have been on South Beach! And if you call to complain at night, you just get a "there's nothing we can to about it," even though the daytime people seem to believe that there is. They need to communicate. So, if you are going to be partying it up anyway, it's good. Otherwise, a bit pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to get a good night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Kademing1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week to take in the sites and sun of Miami and the surrounding regions. We chose thi location rather than somewhere like South Beach so we could get a little peace and quiet in the evening, what a mistake. Right next door to the hotel is a club which blasts its bass heavy music until 2 am EVERY night. We called the front desk several time, they said they would call the club, or call the police, but eventually we were informed that nothing could be done because the club owner has a permit to play his music as loud as he wants until 2am. We asked if we could be moved to another room, but this was apparently an unreasonable request. I'm not sure why they couldn't move us, the place seemed deserted the week we were there. Bottom line, unless you plan to be out until the wee hours of the morning yourself, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: TripMaster61
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta in Coconut Grove is in a super location. The hotel staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: janellmer
Reviews.Content: All your employees are wonderful! We always find our stay to be just perfect! One comment: Please get the Tennis Channel! We love watching the tournament live but also love coming back to our "home" away from home and watch it on TV. Thanks for a great experience and looking forward to next year!

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel, convenient walking to restaurants, shops”
Reviews.Author: LouiHeldman
Reviews.Content: For our family that includes two college students, this was an excellent choice. We stayed in a 2-bedroom apartment that included a small kitchen that opened to a large living room, then on to a wraparound deck with postcard views of Biscayne Bay. The staff was friendly and courteous. We were a bit concerned about the need to use valet parking, but the $23 a day price was included in the room package and, if we called from our room, the car was already there, or arrived within moments of us getting to the front door. The hotel could use a cosmetic update, but we found it very clean and well-run. The hotel is within a short walk of Coconut Grove's many eclectic shops and restaurants. This isn't the place to stay if you want to spend much time on South Miami Beach, because Miami traffic is horrendous during heavy tourist months. If that's not a problem for you, the Sonesta is a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service, beautiful site, the best of everything!”
Reviews.Author: susiq185
Reviews.Content: We scheduled our daughter's wedding at Sonesta Bayfront Hotel the first week of March 2011. The event coordinator, Francy Silva, was on top of her game! She is extremely organized, kowledgeable and just overall outstanding at her job! She provided detailed accounting, and there were no surprises. There isn't a thing she missed and everything went perfectly according to plans! After the ceremony, the happy hour and reception, and next day brunch were above our greatest expectations - the food was delicious and all our guests raved about the quality of the meals. The service, lead by John and Omar, was impecable. Their genuine concern to make everything perfect was wonderful. They catered to every need, including children's and vegetarian menus. The expression on the children's faces when Omar and John's team served them their very own giant chocolate chip cookie was priceless! Also, Victoria Villasis in the reservations department did a great job in coordinating all our family and friends' hotel rooms! Francy and her team really know know how to make everyone feel special. Our daughter and son-in-law were so happy with the wedding, we could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for my Groups and individual travelers looking for a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: jcatravelservices
Reviews.Content: My travel agency have been using the Sonesta for the last 3 years for groups and individual travelers. The location, the staff, the rooms and the service are great! The most important thing for me when booking a hotel is to have a staff that cares and understands how hospitality should work... Veronica and Elizabeth from the reservation's department really know about customer service and always have a solution for any issue I may have with my clients. Juan Carlos Alonso JCA Travel Services Inc

Reviews.Title: “corporate reunion”
Reviews.Author: david1020
Reviews.Content: I hosted a dinner for 13 people. it was a reunion of executives from a local corporation. it was a glorious evening. the food, the sevice, could not have been better. the people were so helpful and pleasant. I would recommend this sonesta hotel to all. my accommendations were first class. I hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Holibobcats
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere within easy reach of the airport, away from the hustle of the city, but had enough going on to get the trip off to an interesting start. And that's what we found. The location was great. Coconut Grove is a cute, upmarket neighbourhood. The hotel is just across the road from the bay and a couple of blocks from a some nice, relaxed, pavement cafes. We ate at one for dinner, and another for a lazy breakfast the next morning. The hotel itself is smart and clean. I would say it's more of a functional business style hotel than a fashionable one, but is far superior to the lower end of the market (as the prices make clear). The real plus is the roof top pool - a swim there was the perfect start to the first day of our trip. It felt properly 'Miami' to me. The valet parking seemed expensive, but we soon realised that $23 overnight is pretty reasonable for these parts. Front desk were nice. They gave us an upgrade to a suite with a balcony (not overlooking the water), which came with a full kitchenette and a big bathroom. So, not a great view, but more facilities than we needed. All in all, Sonesta gave us a really civilised start to the holiday. We liked it so much, we tried to get a room there a week later, when we were passing back through the city, but the lowest rates available were at least twice what we paid through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, building work finished,”
Reviews.Author: briankirk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a business trip. I requested a quiet room and was allocated 1704-1. This room overlooked the bay and down on the pool. The room was very quiet, comfy and clean and a good size. The Gym was great and the pool area pleasant. The hotel is south of Miami but there is a pleasant community area with bars and restaurants. Watch out for bar prices ($8 for a beer). We travelled to Miami Beach one evening for a change of scene. 17 of us to eat, $1100 bill !!!!! never again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta is a nice hotel. They deluxe or above rooms are better with a kitchen and a bigger balcony. The parking fee is high and they charge a high price on any small items you may have forgotten. The pool area and view are wonderful. Drinks start at $10 and go up from there. The service at the restaurant is excellent. The scent in the lobby is very strong and needs to be toned down. I have never been to a hotel where they constantly check at the door to make sure that people coming in are staying there. Good in some ways but a little odd. Location to Coconut Grove is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and over priced”
Reviews.Author: angten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before leaving for a 3-week trip to Argentina/Chile. We didn't rent a car and the location was perfect. Unfortunately our experience wasn't. This hotel has an identity problem: hotel or condominium? Our room had a nice view and that's about all we can say for it. The television worked with great difficulty, the rugs were dirty and curtain torn. The shower head was broken and it was only fixed after persistent calls to the front desk. The front desk had never communicated the problem to engineering. The window was broken and never fixed. We have traveled all over the world and have never returned to a hotel room after being away all day to find the room not cleaned, bed still unmade. We called the front desk and after waiting some time for housekeeping, finally went down to the lobby and talked to them. Our room wasn't cleaned until well after 5 PM. This is totally unacceptable when staying at a hotel, especially one that advertises itself as 4 star. There are many alternatives in Coconut Grove, anyone of which would be better than this poorly managed hotel. The desk staff while pleasant had virtually no local knowledge; it took us a great deal of time and effort to locate the stop of the Grey Line tour of Miami which was a few hundred yards from the hotel. Anyone expecting the usual sort of information from the hotel desk will be sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: michaellee1
Reviews.Content: great place to stay.The staff is great,ask for (ELSY)...

Reviews.Title: “One employee can make all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: FutureBride_11
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the employee was not very friendly or hospitable. We loved our room and the setting- We spent a very rainy hour up at the pool and Alex was an AMAZING attendant to us. He moved my swim coverup out of the rain, brought us warm towels and as we sat chatting under the covered area in very cozy seats, he brought my future husbands shoes right to him. Alex's hospitality really touched us-we felt very cared for and valued. Thank you Alex for all your effort! Your are a GREAT asset to that hotel :) Christy Markussen

Reviews.Title: “I am always impressed by the kindness of the staff and cleanliness of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TakemeawayDC
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Sonesta, and it's beginning to feel like a home away from home, that I don't have to clean! My room has always been neat and spotless, and service is fast. I had a problem with my room safe, and repairman was at my door to fix it within five minutes of my call to the front desk. Housekeeping and front desk staff are friendly, and the view from the Bayview Rooms is beautiful. Coconut Grove is a quaint area with great restaurants, fun nightlife, and shopping, and it's a short drive to downtown Miami. I highly recommend staying at the Sonesta.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- Glad I Didn't Have to Pay!”
Reviews.Author: THEBafanaBafana
Reviews.Content: I was travelling for work and was put here. The hotel is wonderful, I wish I had more time to enjoy it while I was down there. Coconut Grove itself is also very nice, again, I wish I had more time to enjoy it. After the meeting I relocated to South Beach for some vacation time where I found a cheaper place in Miami Beach that was closer to the beaches. That said, if I had money to burn, the Sonesta would have been a wonderful place to do it! The rooms were great, clean and comfortable. The TVs in the room were huge with great channel selection, and each room had its own wireless router which meant the internet was really fast! The staff was very friendly. I never got a chance to try the hotel in the restaurant, but if the food that they catered to us for our meeting was any indication I'm sure it is incredible. The one downside (besides price) to the Sonesta that I found was its location. Coconut Grove is very nice, but it didn't seem to me to be as much to do as elsewhere in Miami. It would be a great place to stay if you have a car. I didn't and wanted to be within walking distance of South Beach for my time in Miami after the meeting. That, and price, were my primary reasons for relocating after the meeting was over. Overall I would definitely recommend the Sonesta to anyone who has the money to afford it!

Reviews.Title: “The Sonesta is wonderful, my colleagues and I return each year!”
Reviews.Author: simonajm
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove is a wonderful hotel in a great location. My colleagues and I stay there every year because it is lovely, clean, comfortable, huge rooms with great views and convenient to restaurants in addition to easy commuting to our work site. The Sonesta is definitely a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: havlyn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great area. The hotel is atleast 18 stories tall. There is a deck with a nice view of harbor and park. The rooms where spacious, great food and the chef was very friendly. The incidental fee is expensive 40.00 a night. It had a full gym. Overall A+

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: marcalbin
Reviews.Content: Coconut Grove is such a fun area!! The Sonesta is the best place to stay there!! Great location, great vacation, everyone is so friendly there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous on many levels!”
Reviews.Author: BWB1021
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed this hotel and highly recommend it for business or leisure. The service was impeccable. My room was spacious with full kitchen; however the dining options were exceptional inside the hotel. The Panorama Restaurant & Sky Lounge's menu and service was exceptional. The Peruvian menu was great. Although most of my time was spent inside the hotel (for training); a very short walk to the CocoWalk for shopping, dining,and entertainment was available for free time. The bay side offers a wonderful walk along the marina. The pool area was wonderful day or night. The adjoining rooms are ideal for a "girls trip" or families, but I would also feel comfortable traveling alone to this hotel. Construction was going on in November, but the staff made every effort to minimize its impact; and they did a great job. So I welcome another opportunity to visit this hotel. Being in an intensive training didn't allow a lot of free time, but the staff made sure we were comfortable and accommodated in the sessions. I ordered room service on my last day, and the eggs benedict was the best I have ever had. I have not ordered another since leaving the Sonesta because I don't think it would measure up. Kudos to the chef (which I expressed)! The Panorama Ceviche was beautiful and delicious. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but nice pool with splendid view”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta hotel is located close to the water in Coconut Grove. The location could probably not be better in the Grove. For other parts of Miami the location is also OK, not too much of a hassle to get around. Arriving at the hotel the first problem is to find a place to park. There is a garage next door to the hotel charging $15 per day. The hotel charges $23 for the valet - we had considered parking at the garage but since we were going to come and go several times during the days it seemed easier to go for the valet parking. Still I do believe that they charge to much for parking. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful upon check-in. We were a bit early but they arranged for another room, a better than we booked, for us. Still I got to say I was a bit disappointed seeing the room. The rooms are fairly small to be in the US (would be considered large in Europe) but they were still OK. The room offer all the things expected but it is clear that it is not new. The TV was a flat screen but looking at the picture quality it is either an older model or a cheap model (the Hampton Inn and the Best Western I stayed at earlier the same trip had much better TVs). The coffee maker was also a bit old and could not really heat the water to required temperature. The good things were however a nice balcony with views of the water, very comfortable bed and nice bathtub. The room would however benefit from adding some new furniture and replacing TV etc. The biggest issue I had was however the sloppy cleaning. The first day I did not notice anything special but the second day I dropped my wallet on the floor and when I bent down I also got a good look under the bed and there was a nice thick layer of dust there. That prompted me to check a few other places (under the chest of drawers, on the shelves etc) with equally bad results. It appears is if the cleaning staff only do the quick and easy things and skip the actual cleaning (would of course not be necessary to do every day but the dust under the bed rather suggested it was several months since the last time). The pool is very nice and has nice views of the water. There is also a jacuzzi beside the pool. We did not try the restaurant but it seemed a bit pricey for what was on offer. The hotel also offered a nice fitness center, it was located at the very top floor with nice views of the city. There are also 2 squash courts in the hotel - a real nice addition but since I did not know it when I booked I did not bring my racket (the ones available to borrow where pretty poor quality). The exterior of the hotel was undergoing some renovation, did not really disturb as they appeared to be working on the city side of the hotel. The annoying parts of the hotel were more the fact that they try very hard to be more of a upscale hotel but do not really have the necessary quality to do it. What then remains is more of overcharging for average quality. Still the hotel is fairly decent to be in the .rove

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we had a very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hermionebee7
Reviews.Content: Our room with two doubles had a sink, microwave and mini-fridge. Our relative's room with the king had a complete kitchen. The bedding included down comforters and cotton sheets; the beds were very comfortable for sleeping. There was construction going on outside but this never impacted our sleep. All in all the rooms were excellent. We liked the hotel location. It was a convenient drive to area attractions (Everglades, Biscayne, Vizcaya, Fairchild Tropical Gardens) south of Miami and a short drive to Miami Beach. There are several great restaurants within walking distance. Parking was a bit of a hassle. $23 for valet parking. We parked in the municipal garage next door for $15. The folks at the front desk were always friendly. The housekeepers were great. We forgot to pack an electric toothbrush. Called the hotel and they promptly mailed it to us. That's excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “A three dressed up as a nine.”
Reviews.Author: Mozartium
Reviews.Content: Our party arrived New Year's Eve day at the end of a Cruise to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. When we all went down to the bar for cocktails at 5:30 we were not allowed to enter the bar because, we were told, that there was only one seat at the bar and the empty tables were reserved for others. We had to leave this $400.00 a night hotel to have drinks elsewhere. Everything costs extra in this hotel including $10.00 for a bandaid, no joke. Our breakfast service which we requested at 10:00am never arrived until 12:00 after several failed attempts with the wrong order. If you are looking for an affordable and pleasant traveling experience stay away from this place because you won't get either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: tabascomom
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel in Coconut Grove. Fla. We have stayed many times and it has always been fabulous! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: mrfood
Reviews.Content: booked sonesta on splendia lux hotel site for 2 nights, hotel was very nice, walking distance to main street and also to bayfront area. room a little small, reminded me of w hotels with more closet and drawer space. room was very nicely appointed and had small balcony overlooking pool which was on 8th floor pool was great as was the panorama rest next to pool. staff teriffic especially food director john avellino who took care of my grandchilds nut allergy food problem. all staff members really helpful and had very nice stay. would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, LOVE IT (WOULD LIKE TO STAY WHOLE YEAR)”
Reviews.Author: Richard20282930
Reviews.Content: We pass our 22nd Anniversary night at the hotel, it was perfect, the only thing that was missing was the Miami hot weather so we can used and enjoy the pool. The Suite was very nice, they even put us a bottle of wine and fruits. the view to the bay a dream come true, specially next day in the morning having breakfast at the balcony. Bed very confortable and the bathtub was A+. Will recomend to everybody , also try Panorama restaurant (with a Peruvian Menu) I'm Peruvian, and let tell you; food is good and almost the same like a very good Restaurant in Peru.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SphagnumMoss
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed staying here. In addition to being a secure environment, it was well located, clean and chock full of friendly staff. Humberto, our service person iat the restaurant, was exceptional. In addition to great service, he helped us make some choices from the appetizing menu. An exquisite experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not top 10”
Reviews.Author: ConeRod
Reviews.Content: As with so many things, the ratings in Trip Advisor come with the implied statement "for the price". The Sonesta is a good hotel, and may be a great value depending on what you pay, but it isn't one of the top 10 hotels in the Miami area. The hotel had some minor construction going on while I was there. The mandatory valet service was inefficient and having to get buzzed into the garage every time seemed clumsy when so many better systems can be found at other hotels. The maid failed on more than one occasion to replace our in room coffee. The one day I decided to sit by the pool I was chased off by the window washers. I couldn't find a seat on the deck that was protected from their spray. On at least two nights I was serenaded to sleep by the booming base sounds of the night club next door. The music was loud enough and clear enough even on the ninth floor for me to recognize the songs. The bedding was good quality, and there was a flat screen TV but overall the feel of the hotel was not 4 star impressive. The bathroom was functional but small. The WiFi seemed flaky. We had a drain issue, but maintenance was quick to fix it. The toilet seat was either too thick or had become warped so that it would not stay up. The hot tub closes at sunset. Staff was friendly. Depending on what you pay this may be a great hotel "for the price". For the price I paid, and the reviews on this site, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: gapeach1970
Reviews.Content: We go there after dark so we couldn't see very from our balcony. I got up the next morning and wow,a view of the bay. That night we wanted to get out of the room and it was nice,food and shops are walking distance. The staff was very helpful when we asked where a good place to go was. The room and all the common areas are very clean and the bed was amazing!! I booked through priceline so you never know where you will be,hope to get this one again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Superb!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalbs5050
Reviews.Content: As President of my first travel group I picked the Sonesta not realizing what to expect, and I must say it was worth every penny! It didn't hurt that the restaurant is close by many of the attractions, including "Crazy Piano' and "Fat Tuesdays" everything was so convenient! The lobby and rooms were impeccable. I loved the sweet but subtle scent that greets you when you enter The Sonesta. Overall, my group and I loved our experience. We got a good rate in general on our stay, but quite honestly I would pay more to enjoy the experience again on my next Miami stay. The staff knew my name and made us feel like the power women we are :). The only downer was the construction being made in the front of hotel- it's rather drabby and doesn't fit the gem inside, but once the doors spring open it's quite impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Ms. Nicole Loo, Assistant Front Office Manager, provided exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: jannifer_johnson
Reviews.Content: Ms. Nicole Loo provided exceptional service and made certain that I was pleased with my 1st stay at the Sonesta. Ms. Loo went above and beyond and was committed to my being comfortable in one of the Sonesta's nicest hotel rooms. She was professional, knowledgeable, courteous and intelligent. Primarily because of Ms. Loo's impressive service, I'll be certain to make the Sonesta my hotel of choice when traveling to Miami. Thank you for the opportunity to recognize one of your most outstanding representatives! Happy Holidays, Dr. Jannifer Johnson

Reviews.Title: “When in Miami, we always stay right here!”
Reviews.Author: deemail
Reviews.Content: Used to be that we tried a new hotel every trip, but just like Goldilocks, we finally found The Sonesta and it really is 'just right'! The Hotel is great, and after these new renovations should be superb...BUT, it is very much the PEOPLE who make this place a wonderful experience. To name a few, Claudia Zellner who has it all under control and always with a bright beautiful smile. Nathan at the front desk. In the restaurant, Aura Lopez, Ruben Morales, and Svetlana Guerra make everyone feel at home. Marco de la Guarda-the guardian angel, helping hands and smiling face. Its our home from home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in many ways”
Reviews.Author: RayPays
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing renovation so there is work afoot. But the hotel staff is working very hard so that it does not intrude on the visit. Was here for a meeting which the hotel did a fine job with. Great location for Coconut Grove nightlife. The rooms are a bit small and rather plain but the beds make up for anything that could be construed as even mildly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT THANKSGIVING GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: CCC57
Reviews.Content: Very nice 4 night stay. Large clean rooms. However, to those of you that are accustomed to staying in a "real" luxury 4 star hotel, you will be a little dissappointed. I have no complaints and I would stay here again but now I know exactly what to expect in the luxury department. We loved Coconut Grove area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyermom
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern art throughout. There is construction/remodeling going on right now, but it was not a problem for me. Good bed--quite comfortable. Free internet (wired and wireless). Room has refrigerator, microwave, stove. Restaurant has Peruvian cuisine. Kt was pretty good. Service was a bit slow though. Room service was fine and on time. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in all areas!”
Reviews.Author: Sailing_St_Augustine
Reviews.Content: Of course the view was lovely off the balcony, and the room was sized well. The bed was very comfortable with first-class amenities all the way. Room was spotlessly clean including the restroom.There was no noise apparent at night which made for restful sleeping. CocoWalk was a block away for fun shopping. The restaurant/bar at the hotel had the best service staff I have encountered! Would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Justcool457
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was â€œoh no itâ€™s under renovationâ€�. But as I entered the lobby that feeling of disappointment disappeared and never returned. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the room was always clean, towels were changed daily, and toiletries were alway refilled maid service excellent, the view from bayside room is breathtaking. Great location for relaxing, quiet, safe, lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: scoopofcoco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at he Sonesta this past weekend and I was very impressed with the hotel. I arrived and was greeted very warmly by Elsy who, after explaining how bad my travel was, informed me I could check into my room early. My room was spacious with a kitchen area complete with stove, ice making refrigerator, and dish washer! The view from my room (1806-2) was amazing. I went to the hotel restaurant for drinks and breakfast and had wonderful service. Roly, Ivan, and Humberto were excellent. My checkout was fast and easy and Elsy made me want to come back. It's also by the pool and has a wonderful view of the marina. The hotel is convienent to many shops, dining, and music. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Sonesta seems inconsiderate, that sums it all up...”
Reviews.Author: kingcoug
Reviews.Content: I had taken an all night flight to Miami for my wedding. I was exhausted when I got to the hotel. My room was not ready for check in so I sat on the couch in the lobby and soon fell asleep. I was then surprised to find myself being rousted from my resting place on the couch by one of the hotel security guards. He told me "don't sleep in our lobby". I thought to myself how nice, maybe you could get my room ready for occupancy and I would not have to clutter the beautiful lobby with my loathesome presence. I have a new and better appreciation for the troubles of the homeless after being treated like a bum as a waiting guest! A helpful hint to others in the same situation: mention that you might want to cancel your reservation and stay across the street at the Ritz Carlton Hotel and the staff will spring into action to serve you though. I observed one couple do this during my time of half conscious loitering in the Sonesta lobby. They received the most attentive and thorough groveling session that I have seen in awhile as the staff worked to "keep their valued business and loyalty". My room was on the 14 th floor. Starting at 7 am I experienced jackhammers, nailers, shovels and drills in true IMAX Theater fashion. I am a usually sound sleeper but I could not take it so I got up and headed out early for the day because the noise was so loud. I did not call to complain. I think it would have been pointless. It is a nice looking place and it seemed clean. The older bald guy in the white smock working the lobby always seemed to be pleasant too- maybe he should be put in charge of the operation...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: werldtravlr
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Miami to visit a family member at U of Miami and I spent HOURS trying to find a hotel which would not mean a lot of driving. I also was looking for at least an ocean view, since I was traveling from Ohio. After reading review after review, I finally settled on Bayfront Sonesta where they had a visa deal going on (all you had to do was pay for the room with a visa). This is a hotel where the website photos actually match EXACTLY what the hotel looks like. The decor was elegantly simple, with original artwork everywhere. The room was in perfect order and always looked like new each afternoon. The view was just what I hoped, and we spent time on our balcony morning and night. I also want to mention that EVERY staff member greeted us everywhere we went and seemed genuinely concerned with making our stay meet our needs, without being pushy or over gracious. We ate breakfast at the hotel the first day, as a last resort because hotel breakfasts are so often way overpriced for what you get. I have to say it was the best breakfast (french toast with mango and other fruit) I have ever had in a hotel. While not cheap, it was worth it. We even went back the second day. All three of us had excellent meals and the staff was wonderful. I took many photos of our room, the view, etc, but they look just like the photos other travelers have shared. This trip was a perfect getaway and I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: JerryDonQ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property about 15 times. The service and staff have been impeccable since my first stay. The rooms are very spacious, the beds are extremely comfortable and the views are postcard material. The staff really pamper the guests and make you feel at home, relaxed and always treat you like a VIP. Location is excellent as you have plenty of night life, good restaurants and just minutes from South Beach, Coral Gables and Brickell. Highly Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “simple elegance”
Reviews.Author: MB10751
Reviews.Content: We have consistently stayed at the Sonesta Bayfront since we took our son to the University of Miami as a freshman in 2007. Our first impression was one of simple elegance. The staff are warm, pleasant, and efficient. The rooms are clean, tastefully decorated and very comfortable. While one of the biggest draws for us, besides the location, is the wonderful 8th floor outdoor pool overlooking the bay; the feeling of calm as I step into the serenely decorated lobby is also a big plus. As a travel pass member, I have had the pleasure of working with Claudia Zellner who is always available to attend to any questions or amenities I need. I highly and without reservation recommend a stay at the Sonesta bayfront Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Cutelala
Reviews.Content: Great place, nice and clean hotel. U have to wait though for a good price because it is expensive

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to refer to friends and business associates”
Reviews.Author: suzypr
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta is the perfect hotel for friends and business associates. I have referred many clients and friends to the Hotel and always make a special request for Claudia at the Front Desk because she always goes the extra distance to make the stay an easy and enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in all of Coconut Grove! The beds, sheets and pillows are soft and heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: jeffboca1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the most amazing weekend at the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel in coconut Grove. 1. The views from the rooftop pool of Biscayne Bay, with all the beautiful sailboats is spectactular! Probably the most impressive view I have expereinced in Miami. Brought back memories of the south of Spain in the summer. The whole vibe was very Mediteranean. 2. The room was bigger than we expected. Most pleasant surprise was how comfortable the beds were. The sheets and pillows were sumptuous, best 2 nights of sleep I have ever had at a hotel. 3. The staff we encountered were all very professional and cordial. 4. The pool deck, on the 8th floor has a great Peruvian restuarant. The Mahi Mahi sandwich was my favorite. (Make sure to order the sweat potato fries) My wife and I are hoping to return soon. I have already recommended this hotel to several freinds. If you want to expereince the best of Coconut Grove, the Sonesta Bayfront Hotel definitely has the most to offer. 5 Stars!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Space"”
Reviews.Author: vickienyy
Reviews.Content: my husband and I met 2 friends from AUSTRALIA (who also stayed at the Sonesta); and they would agree with us, a great place to stay. All the amenities, friendly staff, even with the renovations, there were no issues. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBrit53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always top notch. We have stayed here several times and have never been disappointed. The staff are lovely - friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and spotless. The beds are wonderful! The location is great too, just a couple of minutes walk to the centre of Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Very best experience each time I stayed at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJDI
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 5am at the hotel, I was exhausted and immediately accommodated in my room so I could rest prior to morning meetings. The staff was always helpful and smiling (even at 5am...). The room clean, spacious, great wireless, beautiful view (whether bay view or city one). Though the hotel has been undergoing major renovation, I did not hear any noise... The staff at the Panorama restaurant is outstanding and the food very good. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys great services, surroundings, at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best in a setting that says Miami, with the greatest staff.”
Reviews.Author: BizClassy
Reviews.Content: Repeated stays at Sonesta Bayfront have been rewarding without fail, whether an overnight or a four-day stopover set up on two hours notice. In-house reservation staff is flawless. Overall hotel staff are friendly, alert and terrifically responsive. In the heart of Coconut Grove, a few steps from the Bay and its marinas. The hotel bar and chief bartender are particularly welcoming. Kitchen staff produce excellence, dinners as well as barfood. (Can be pricey but also offers bargains including their "Florida resident" package which waives charges for that necessity of The Grove -- reiable valet parking.)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Madame-S728
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of a hotel in my life, but I felt compelled to warn others about this place. It was horrible. The place is under construction. Balcony was dirty and taped up. Pool was closed. The parking garage stank of urine. No one mentioned that if you self park you have to request a special parking pass or you pay twice as much. The club downstairs blared loud music into the night. The hotel sent me a survey, but the link to the survey of course does not work. Rooms were fine but shabby. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: fritzriga
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times, and its always been a pleasure: very comfortable, well appointed rooms with great views on the bay side; kind and considerate staff; first rate restaurant, nice pool, spa, and gym, great location near places to eat, shop, be entertained, and walk along the waterfront and in lovely areas of Coconut Grove. If you stay here, you'll be very pleased...and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “SONESTA COCONUT GROVE, is a plush, first class hotel, with fantasic staff!”
Reviews.Author: JANETSOLLE
Reviews.Content: We had to travel under sad circumstances, the death of my mom, children's grandma,, and great grandmother. We were greeted so kindly, by wonderful staff. We had to do some room switching, having a suite and 2 other rooms. The staff, the facilities, the plushness I have trusted from Sonesta for many years. All of us wanted to do a special thank you to Nicole, Front Desk , who was so accommodating and kind! We were quite an extended family, and she did everything to make our visit, although it was a sad time, we were in great hands

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Coconut Grove.”
Reviews.Author: vivalamari
Reviews.Content: The room was really comfortable and very clean. The service was superb! Walking distance from the charming CocoWalk area and from the marina, yet far enough to not have to put up with the noise late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Deelectare
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a normal room when I went to Sonesta and my actual room ended up having a kitchen, complete with dishes, oven, stove, etc. It was really great. The staff is very friendly and they gave us directions on where to go to eat, etc. I highly recommend the pizza place around the corner for a quick bite - the pizza is truly New York style (which was a very pleasant surprise since most places can't make true NY style pizza). There is some construction going on in the front of the hotel, but everything within the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Winetast0r
Reviews.Content: To begin, I have traveled a great deal and want to say that I am not a fan of "larger" corporate hotels. However, our experience at the Sonesta rivaled many of the "Botique" hotels that we prefer. The entire staff was well informed, courteous, and very helpful. The overall ambiance was delightful. In particular the rooftop dining and pool were pleasant to the eye and taste, relaxing, quiet, with a great view of the Bay and sailboats especially early in the morning and at sunset. The restaurant is charming, the service was attentive, and the food well-prepared. Relaxing near the pool was delightful--just a few steps from the restaurant. The rooms were well appointed, very clean and quiet. The hotel location allowed us to peruse the shops that were just a few minutes from the front door. Overall, an excellent experience that we would repeat when we return to the Grove.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave our generous corner balcony and the Sonesta art gallery.”
Reviews.Author: artsydesign
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Bay View corner 2 bedroom condo. it was spectacular! The view of the marina and a nearby playground was so interesting, that even though we brought our books out to read, we ended up talking and watching the boats, the kids at the playground, the early morning bicycle riders, and of course, the sea and the sun. Even though Miami in June is quite hot, we always had a sea breeze, so we were completely comfortable! The Cocowalk open air "mall" is across the street when you walk out the back way. The rest of town offers great restaurants and shops. Don't miss Jaguar, our new favorite restaurant and also Green Street Cafe. Both are within easy walking distance. If you are a walker, take a stroll down to Miami City Hall and see all of the boats , both pleasure and commercial, along the way. There are many restaurants, shops, a Starbucks, and a new movie theater, ice cream and live entertainment on the week-end at Cocowalk. Cocowalk is noisy on week-end nights, but we didn't hear a thing from our room, and slept really well. Every staff person at the Sonesta went out of their way to make sure that our needs were met. The little cafe on the pool level has the same spectacular view and the pool (at that level) is high enough that when you look over the pool, you only see sea and sky. The pool attendant may be a little too attentive for my taste...if you got up, he folded your clothes and rearranged towels, so it is always tidy. Beautiful space, super comfortable beds,.a well set up kitchen with full sized refrigerator, stacking washer dryer and surprise half bath were among the condo's many amenities that made this a perfect stay for all of us. Oh, by the way, the Sonesta art collection is so fine that they have a brochure about the art. ask for it! Tip: self-park in the public parking next door to save a little money and avoid waiting for a valet. Note: the front of the hotel was being painted, so we used the back door. Also, next door, towards the water is a charming public library branch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: nicmicj
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Sonesta Bayfront for our 1st anniversary trip. Check-in was easy and quick. We had a room on the 20th floor with a partial bayfront view and king bed. The rooms were very nice and the beds were very comfortable and very nice size bathroom and closet. The pool area was great and comfortable. We had a Sangria that was one of the best I've ever had. The hotel actually gives out complimentary shots during a certain time in the evening and they were great! The jacuzzi and pool were also awesome and never crowded during the times we went. We did not eat at the Panorama Restaurant as there are other very good restaurants in the area and less expensive. Overall, this was a very good place to stay. It is not close to the beach, but there are several things to do and see in Coconut Grove. If my husband and I want to spend our time in Miami hanging out and resting away from a big crowd, we would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for the party scene and happening night life, you may want to stay in South Beach, but Sonesta is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to the Beach, But Great For Nightlife Stay”
Reviews.Author: IFLYHIGH89
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at the hotel for Labor day weekend in 2008 when Hurrican Gustav was threatening to hit (it didn't), and it was great. Very clean (everything in the room was all white) and they had a nice staff. Mounted flat screen tv's are cool. I LOVE how it is literally right next door to the nightlife scene (shopping, great restaurants, bars, etc) My friend and I did not need to drive anywhere but to Miami beach. I would recommend this hotel if you don't want the all night party scene, such as at a Miami beach hotel (plus I heard that Miami beach hotels are not all that fine due to spring breakers and teens destorying things). Sonesta is well worth the price and anyone should love it. I highly recommend trying out the restaurant Jaguar's.. it's down the street and is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Poolside Service”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheSun1803
Reviews.Content: Alex was an attentive, friendly pool attendant who anticipated our needs and made our days at the pool very relaxing and enjoyable! The staff at the Panorama restaurant was cordial and professional. Dining on exotic, delicious Peruvian-inspired cuisine was amazing on the pool deck, overlooking sparkling Biscayne Bay and sailboat-filled marina.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel--from personnel to cleanliness great amenities.”
Reviews.Author: travelerlakeland
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Fitness room overlooking the bay--w/a sauna! The rooms were pristine and very large. Food was excellent and the pool is on the 8th floor! Great art collection too. Great service and personnel were helpful and friendly. Couldn't have asked for better accommodations. Many thanks to the staff --- Even the teenagers were thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “I HATED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: seed723
Reviews.Content: They treated my group very poorly. The customer service was below the DMV. They seem to hate their guests and acted like we were there to serve them. They were full on jackasses to everyone. The hotel bar / restaurant was WAY to small and closed WAY to early. Room service also closed way to early. The maids were overly aggressive about getting in to my room. Why were they looking for something? One of my wake up calls got screwed up. I had a very important package FedExed overnight to the hotel, (I asked about how to do this and what I need to do so that all would go smoothly...), but they screwed it up. Their "Receiving" was closed at 10-11am when it showed up. Later that day when it was discovered that they had screwed up there was no one who could explain why they screwed up. All I got was a "Yes there was a screw up, no I no not know why and their is no one to talk to..." (Code for screw you I don't care, yes you dropped over $2000.00 but we don't care about you, or respect you enough to give you an answer to the question of who screwed up.) Even McDonald's will say they are sorry when they mess up. I HATED THIS HOTEL.... I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN EVEN IF THE RATE WAS 1/10 OF THE RATE WE PAYED. IT WAS RITZ-CARLTON RATES WITH DMV STYLE SERVICE. Motel 6 would would have been better the service is better, you pay less and they seem to be happy you are staying their. I WOULD NOT PAY TO STAY AT ANY HOTEL THAT IS IN ANY WAY CONNECTED TO THIS HOTEL. I hope that the next hurricane that hits Miami wipes this hotel off the face of the planet . so that no one else has to be treated this poorly by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, practical and classy”
Reviews.Author: marsukat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the end of March for the Sony Ericsson tennis tournament on Key Biscayne, and it was the perfect home away from home. We had stayed here for the tournament in '02, and it was better then we remembered. The bayview deluxe has a full kitchen, which was handy for breakfast--we walked down to the Fresh Market a few blocks away on the first day to stock up, as eating breakfast out every day is a great way to suck your wallet dry. Tournament shuttle was around the corner at the Mayfair, which also had a great coffee shop/bookstore. The Coconut Grove neighborhood has a ton of interesting shops and restaurants (and check out Scotty's Landing next to City Hall on the Bay for outstanding casual outdoor dining and cocktails), and just walking around the harbor to the east makes a great afternoon in itself. Room was on the 11th floor facing the park/pool south, with a great view of the bay, and the nice-sized balcony let you take full advantage of it. The bed was comfortable, with nice linens. Bathroom was on the small side but functional, and the provided toiletries were first class. My only minor complaint was that the AC was pretty loud when it kicked on, enough to sometimes wake me up (fortunately didn't have to have it on much as weather was moderate). Overall, a great experience, perfect for what we needed. Coming back after a long day of tennis to that great smelling lobby was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “My bedroom closet is bigger than the bayview suite”
Reviews.Author: ddiazodiaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recently remodelled. The lobby is beautiful. The rooms, however, leave much to be desired. We had several rooms booked as we were there for a wedding. Some guests got double queen bed rooms, decent size, no complaints. The poor guests who got bayview/cityview suite with one king sized bed got totally ripped off. There was not even enough space to walk around the bed. It literally was the size of an oversized walk-in closet. The restaurant is pricey but the bartender on staff during our stay, Alvaro, was amazing. Overnight parking for guest is $30 a night as is the occupancy tax. Also, dont believe them when they promise you an early check-in, none of the guests that asked for it got it. All in all, the hotel is nice but the room sizes leave much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “A bad night sleep due to the "thump thumping" of the ouside bar next to the hotal”
Reviews.Author: kdallman
Reviews.Content: apparently this hotel hasn't developed any relationship with the City Council, Mayor or police department. This is my third night sleeping in this room listening to the sounds of a the outdoor bar next door - could it be possible that this city has no noise ordinance????? not likely - I called down to the font desk to ask bout moving rooms only to be told that they would call me back in "five to ten minutes". They did not call back.... Instead they said that they were calling the PD to address the issue - when I said that I found it hard to belive that they this was a new issue - they gave me the name of the GM - Curtis Cridewr and two numbers to reach him at --- guess what - his name wasn't even on the voice mail - can you say kiss off????? I called back down and sked to speak to the night manager - - what she offered??? ear plugs.... My advise - - -Don't book this hotel unless you are on the bay side - any room not on the bay side is subject to loud noise until at lewast 3:00 am!!!!!!! Eventually sleep deprivation will get the better of you at this hotel and you will end up writing a review of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for its views, service and restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Fattycrab
Reviews.Content: The smallish rooms are the onoly real drawback to this property that has a large number of permanent residents. The service is high at the door and the restaurant is actually very good. It is an alternative choice in lieu of South Beach. This is the anti-South Beach. Nice, quiet luxury is to be found here in a boutique-size setting. Thoughtful amentiies such as Italian soaps and shampoos, TV list, robes, all make for a comfy stay. Lobby is great to meet business people in a laid back setting. Walk next to restaurants and shops. The bed however was not comfy as it was very soft. Nice tub and clean rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “The Sonesta Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelaG7
Reviews.Content: excellent service. Beautiful clean room with large flat screen t.v. Great balcony view of the bay,a weight room over looking the city as you work out, and work off all the food you've eaten from all the great surrounding resturants. Would highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMH79
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view from the pool of the marina and was located in nice part of town. CocoWalk is just 2 blocks away for nightlife. Rooms were average and the pool was small. Not close to the beach at all.

Reviews.Title: “Miles from anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: peterw_in_Wakefield
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist then DONT stay here as its miles from downtown and the beaches. First room was lousy and noisy so got moved to a better room. Staff helpful. No tourist info at all. Not much in surrounding area. $25 taxi to downtown. Station 45 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Coconut Grove for some luxury”
Reviews.Author: AKMiner
Reviews.Content: We had one of their upgraded rooms facing the bay. It had a balcony, full kitchen, livingroom, bedroom and a bath and half for a very reasonable price. They have a very nice small restaruant that serves south american cuisine. We had a very nice, relaxing stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Coconut Grove is a nice place to stay, with great restaurants in a walking distance. We had dinner ina restaurant caled Grenne Strett and loved . The hotel is very good. The room was huge, with a small dining room and kitchen. In the kitchen you can find everything you need. The room was very nice, clean, comfortable and modern, with balcony and a huge plasma Tv. The king sized bed was great, bathroom was large. The pool has a great view. There is a public parking next door for US$ 15,00/ 24 hours, cheaper than hotel parking. We had a pleasant stay, and recomended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Yakkha & Zack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sonesta for three nights and loved every minute of it. First of all, we got a good deal through Hotels.com (around $200/night) and then got upgraded to a city-view "suite" (which honestly was just a room with a kitchenette).
