We found the service in the hotel to be excellent. It was very clean and modern. There's really nice artwork throughout the hotel. Also, the view from the pool/restaurant is AMAZING! We would definitely stay there again and would definitely recommend to others. The only negative was that the hotel parking was expensive ($23/night). We parked next door for $15/night. There's also $4 lots around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible everything else... far from a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristam83
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was not a good one overall. The positives... Good location in coconut grove, rooms were clean (outdated, but clean), and the view of the bay is very nice. The negatives... Three bogus valet charges on my bill that the front desk did not take off. Front desk staff was rude, they hung up on a guest in my party. I was downgraded a room level when I reserved a two bedroom suite, this was used as my wedding night room. When I asked why I was downgraded, they first told me that it was the hotel mistake. Then, they told me I requested it?!? I definitely did not request to be downgraded on my wedding night. Housekeeping started coming into my room at 8AM on my day of checkout, this was the night after my wedding. Housekeeping then proceeded to walk into my husband and I's bedroom and then said, "oh, I thought you checked out". Extremely inappropriate!!! They did not knock, I thought this was very strange. They then started knocking on my door at 9:30 so they could come in and clean. The restaurant I hear is good at night, but for breakfast it was terrible. They messed up my entire family's order, and it took over an hour. Not a four star hotel. I would NOT stay here if it is for a special event, wedding, etc. The custom service was terrible and they were NOT accommodating at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: patsfan627
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Coconut Grove is one of the most fun places in Miami; there are tons of bars, great restaurants, and a nice, bohemian sort of vibe to the neighborhood. I will say that the nightlife is pretty active on the weekends, and you can sometimes hear the music from the clubs (which don't close until 5am), but it's not too loud. I just put the TV on when I wanted to go to sleep and didn't even hear any music. So once again, it didn't bother me, but if you have really sensitive hearing or need a silent room to sleep in, it might bother you. However, the hotel rooms were super nice. I stayed in a suite, which was very clean, comfortable, and pretty modern (not the most modern hotel I've ever stayed in, but it had flat screens at least). Service was excellent, from the valet to the concierge. The concierge even called one of the restaurants he recommended to us to buy us dessert there. The location is outstanding, once again. You're a one and a half minute walk from the center of Coconut Grove. So if you're looking for a fun place in Miami that's not too crazy (a la South Beach) then the Sonesta is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: HARLEY1068
Reviews.Content: I just love this place. Rooms were big, beds GREAT, bathroom GREAT. Service was unbelieveable! Went to the Resturant on 8th and what a meal and service. I will always stay here when I am in the GROVE.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: strandgal
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - it offers a number of room options e.g. large rooms and apartments, which suited all the various needs of our party. The view over the bay is just beautiful and with the pool, restaurant and bar on the 8th floor its very relaxing to sit and enjoy the view. The staff could not do enough for us and gave us some very helpful tips for restaurants, getting about etc. Coconut Grove is not big on highlife but there are a number of really nice restaurants in the area and if you are looking for a relaxing place in Miami, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for High Quality”
Reviews.Author: JKChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while attending a wedding at a nearby hotel. Although staffing seemed light, I always received prompt and good service. Rooms are really quite nice, and are comparable to the lower end of boutique hotels -- not to say that the rooms aren't very clean and updated, which they are. The pool has a great view of Biscayne Bay and was a breeze to use. A good number of restaurants and shops are all within a few blocks' walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: Mande34
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved our stay. This is a high class hotel, but we were able to get a suite for an amazing price. I actually saw a price online but then called because I really was hoping for a deal that would include breakfast and parking. They ended up giving both to us as part of the deal. Everyone was so accommodating. The rooms and the view are gorgeous. All the staff was wonderful. The beds are beautiful and so comfortable. The bathrooms were large and the soaps smelled wonderful. (A nice delicant scent.) All the rooms have huge plasma televisions. We had a view of the bay, looking out on sail boats. It was just wonderful. Our breakfast included just the cold buffet, which had lots of yogurt, fruit, cereals, pastries as well as cheese and deli meat. The warm buffet (which was overpriced at $19) was very well stocked with mini omlettes, pancakes, bacon, sausage, etc. We ended up just taking a $10 credit and ordering off the menu. The french toast with sauteed bananas and mangos and topped with berries and orange maple syrup might have been the best breakfast I ever had. We did spend a lot on tips. However, I believe it is always appropriate to tip people for service. We always tipped the valet and bell hop. That's just standard for service to me. I would say we got an amazing value, but this hotel can be very pricy so it might not always be someplace I can stay in the future. The staff was always friendly and welcoming and we even got a free late check out. Everything here was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: bsems
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a Cuise departure the following day. Looked at several Hotels in the area and Miami Beach area also. The price of this Hotel compared to other Hotels of similar comfort/style is very reasonable. We were very impressed by this Hotel, friendliness of the staff, cleaniness of the entire Hotel and room. We also got upgraded to a Superior room for free. Would recommend this Hotel however the only downfall was the price of the breakfast, $50 for two people we thought was rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean Rooms, Absurd Valet Prices”
Reviews.Author: ljahn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a converted condo building and most rooms are split into a suite and a small separate room. If you're traveling alone you are most likely to receive one of these and let me tell you that the size of the room is smaller than a Manhattan hotel room. I have stayed at most luxury hotels in the miami/ft. lauderdale area and have never been in such a small room. There's no space to put your suitcase! Besides the size, the room was very clean and the bath was comfortable. The room had a 40" LCD TV and complimentary wireless internet (the speed of the connection was very slow). The bed was vey good but even on a monday night on the 12th floor you could clearly hear the loud bass & drums from the nightclub that is next to the hotel, something that may prevent some people from sleeping. There is a single ice machine located on the 9th floor, something unheard of in any hotel that pretends to be a 4 star. The restaurant is very small and pricey but has an excellent view of the bay. The worst part of the hotel is the $23/day charged for valet parking, this was abusive.` Overall the hotel was not bad, but there are plenty of better choices in Miami for the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: theotherkatie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sonesta in Coconut Grove for four nights. We booked from the hotel's website and got a rate of $125/night for a "Superior City View Room". Considering the price, the hotel greatly exceeded my expectations. My friend and I arrived at 9:30am. Check-in is at 3pm. Not only did they allow us to check-in early, we both received room upgrades. We did not encounter any problems during our stay, and all the staff we interacted with were very courteous and helpful. This may not be the fanciest place to stay in Miami, but it's relatively cheap, in a great location, and you can expect to have a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Coconut Grove!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnja
Reviews.Content: I had previously heard great things about the Sonesta chain of hotels. With this being my maiden stay with the company, I can say that the Sonesta Bay Front property in Coconut Grove, FL does not disappoint. The lobby is well appointed and very modern. The rooms themselves are equally modern and were very clean with a satisfying array of ammenities. I will say though that as nice as the rooms were, I would have liked them to be a little bigger in size. (Side note, their shampoo & conditioner are great! They come in this amazing mango-coconut scent that I am still trying to find back home here in the Northeast. ) The hotel was an amazing outdoor pool located on the 8th floor. Again, the pool is not very large, though what it lacks in size, it makes up for with the amazing views you get from the pool area (great sweeping views of the bay and rest of Coconut Grove). While some of the hotel staff were really nice and impressively helpful they seemed to work alongside some colleagues who seemed indifferent at best (like some of the concierge staff and pool bar staff). This hotel is within walking distance (about 3 blocks) from the heart of Coconut Grove's downtown area. The Coco Walk facility is so close by as are many other restaurants, bars and shops. This downtown area stays open quite late. However, note that this hotel is not very close to the beach. South Beach is the closest beach area located about 15 minutes by car from the hotel (approximately $30 by taxi one way). As I was told by the hotel, there is no direct public bus route that goes from Coconut Grove to South Beach - so your transport options are pretty much limited to a rental car or taxi. This hotel is also about a 30 minute ride from the airport. This is a great hotel which I would definitely recommend it to friends. When booking your stay, make sure to check on the hotel's site for special deal and packages. You can avail of significantly cheaper rates if you book 14-21 days earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Some minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: DriCa_SP
Reviews.Content: OK, I like it very much staying at the coconut grove Sonesta because it is very near to restaurants and shops for those days when you donÂ´t feel like taking the car and going far... but this time I had some little issues... First of all, my travel agent did a mess and booked my mother and I in a Deluxe bayfront... when we got there we found out they did not have a deluxe bayfront with 2 beds... so we were 'downgraded' to a partial bay view... no apologies, no compensation, no nice gesture to make us feel better (the room we received was about 10 to 20 USD per day cheaper than the one we had reserved through our agent). Just " Do you want it or not?". I know it was not their problem, however, as a guest that has been there more than 4 times I would expect something different from their indifference. The room was big enough, however and did include a small kitchenette which was very convenient for us. Another point is that housekeeping was not that efficient as in the other times I have stayed here ... They did not even replace the complimentary coffee even when asked (with a nice thank you note and a tip included) ... I have to compliment, however, the guys from parking which were efficient, helpful and nice. Also the guys who took care of our luggage were always great and nice to talk to. Great staff. One evening we tried their restaurant (Panorama). It was also very good and their creme brulee was just divine... All in all, even though we had some minor problems we had a nice stay there and at the end we were happy that we had chosen to stay at the sonesta... They just have to be careful to keep things in good order...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Missing Somethings”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-60653
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Sonesta for 7 days. We were upgraded to a Bay View suite which was a nice gesture by the hotel. We had a suite on the 19th floor which had stunning views of Miami. The noise level mentioned my others was minimal because we were on a high floor. I highly recommend the one bedroom suites, with a full kitchen, because it makes you feel at home. The suite had 1 1/2 baths. They were average, so nothing to rave about. The valet staff was friendly. What was missing was a daily news paper. This is the first time I have stayed at a hotel where a newspaper was not left at the door every morning. Another problem was that the cleaning staff does not clean underneath the beds. I dropped something and noticed a pile of dust and an old perfume bottle which must of been there for months. Overall, the suite size was great (about 800 sq ft) and the location to restaurants and shops in Coconut Grove was fantastic. If you are looking for an alternative to South Beach, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great view”
Reviews.Author: SilBrasil
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, nice breakfast and beautiful view from the restaurant. Nice pool. Very clean. Service good. Would stay again. Good price for the value. The sound of the night life doesnÂ´t bother that much. Amazing bed! Good bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good!Just a few mistakes...”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: Dont stay in rooms above the 8 th floor where the restaurants are!Loud music til the first morning hours! The room was big(deluxe city view),with full kitchen.The bathroom was not that good.There are mirrors only in the bathroom,when my husband was there I had no place to make up ! The parking is very,very expensive! The staff was very nice with us,a special remark to Elsy Martinez!The manager,Claudia,was also very pleasant too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, spoiled by one member of staff”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Ryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a shopping trip to Miami with my fiance. When we arrived we were met by a very pleasant girl at reception (Elsy) who upgraded us to a nicer room, had to wait a little to get into it, but it was worth it. Rooms are very modern with all the usual items, flat screen, air con, safe etc. We had a balcony which afforded great views of the city. There's a hotel bar on the 8th floor with a fantastic view of the bay and surrounding area. The pool is also located here. The only thing that spoiled our weekend was a very rude front of house manager (Claudia) when we tried to check out early. Having been told some information twice by two separate members of staff about the penalty for early check out, the front of house manager would not honour this and became quite defensive and stated that was not her problem that we had been given wrong information. Eventually after much negotiation, we reached an agreement. On a separate matter, while Coconut Grove is a nice place, there's not much to do in the area. Two days is enough to spend here. If you're coming to Miami, I'd suggest splitting it between Coconut Grove and South Beach (where we went for one day after leaving Coconut Grove).

Reviews.Title: “upscale hotel in upscale neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: deacon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sonesta Bayfront in March. Hotel is very nice, Rooms very good size, clean and confortable. Hotel lobby art deco look spacious, confortable. Staff unbelievably friendly and helpful. Parking was expensive, however right next door( I mean right next door ) there is a parking garage for half the price. No way getting around the parking fees in the area. The hotel restaurant was quite upscale. Nice view overlooking the bay. Outside terrace was perfect for cocktail and dinner if not too windy. There were five of us for dinner, all had different entrees and all were quite satisfied, but on the expensive side ($15 hamburger). Careful on the gratuity as it is automatically added in. We found that to be an issue in th Coconut Grove area in that some restaurants added it in others did not. Check your bill carefully. Coconut Grove was a very nice area. Lots of history, lots of activities, shops, restaurants all less that 5 min walk. Traffic is an issue in Miami so always build in enough time. Also check out the Mayfair hotel. Just as nice if not nicer about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably look at other hotels first, before returning again.”
Reviews.Author: ragcb99
Reviews.Content: To start with the positives of the hotel, the decor is very beautiful and lobby is very upscale. The valet staff are hard workers and very pleasant. The bed is great and room was nicely decorated and large. The hotel in located is mostly a good area. Within walking distances to food and shops, although becareful when walking at night. Our waiter recommended a store and pharmacy near by. The neighborhood really changed within a few streets and a couple of beggars were asking us for money. We thought we had booked a bayside room, but we didn't. we had a room facing the city and it was very loud at times. Upon checking into our room, we found lipstick on the glasses to drink out of. We mentioned our concerns to the night front desk. Nothing was every done. Be aware when checking in. This hotel like others have a $23.00 a day parking fee that is not included in your reservation. Also just FYI, if traveling with children, there is one pool on the 8th floor that closes at 7pm. Also, for a large hotel there is only one restaurant, bar, and drink machine that we could find. We travel a lot and agree that we would look at other options next time before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: BoltonAnnB
Reviews.Content: Arrived after long flight from U.K. Staff on reception lovely and very welcoming. Room nice, modern and clean, a little compact compared to other USA hotels we have stayed in, Bed very comfortable, quiet and very good blinds so able to get a good njghts sleep. Breakfast was quite extensive and had superb fruit selection, the orange juice was the best I've ever had. Staff in restaurant excellent and the view was stunning. Hotel in a safe location and we were able to go for a walk from the hotel to the nearby Marina.

Reviews.Title: “If in Coconut Grove, a worthy stay”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel_on_the_go
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta delivers excellent service from the valet to the waitstaff. I don't know that I would have chosen the Sonesta (or Coconut Grove for that matter) as a vacation destination unless it was a weekend getaway. We were there for a wedding, which was handled very well. Shop around online before booking. Some of my fellow wedding guests found prices that were less than half of what I paid (by booking each night individually). But, that was probably symptomatic of current economic climate. Deluxe rooms with two beds include Queen sized beds. Rooms are spacious. There is a kitchenette. Valet parking was $23 per day. Heated pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: dsushee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotelopia who gave us a fantastic deal for Â£35 per night - I couldn't believe it. We stayed in Miami on a stopover to Belize on the way there and on the way back and thought that the hotel might reflect the cost we paid. We were so pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean, friendly, in excellent condition and when we arrived we were upgraded to an ocean view both times. The beds are enormous (which was great for the jet-lag) and the bath was big enough to fit a 6ft rugby player in with ease!. The breakfast was also included in our deal which I have to say was delicious. Fresh fruit and yogurt or pastries and cooked breakfast for the buffet with a starbucks tea or coffee included. The restaurant overlooks the harbour too which is lovely when you're dining. Just round the corner is coco walk, a small shopping district with restaurants, clothe shops and even a cinema - not bad for being out of north/south beach. We would totally recommend anyone staying here - and would absolutely stay here again when we next visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the best hotel deal ever”
Reviews.Author: GordonWorcester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights when taking part in Miami Marathon. Got an amazing deal with Hotelopia for Â£58 a night. Was upgraded to a bay view room and would not have had a clue that there was a nightclub near the hotel. Lovely, spacious room, fantastic friendly staff, lovely warm swimming pool. Very close to restaurants, bars and Cocoa Row shopping Centre. Well connected via Coconut Grove Circulator bus from across the street which connected with Metro Rail for only a quarter. Cost of Metro Rail only 2 dollars. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “An oustanding hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: drive201
Reviews.Content: I arranged for a 3-day stay for a group of 14 college classmates. It was an outstanding experience. The staff is one of the friendliest I have ever encountered. The service was excellent. We dined at the hotel the first evening we were there and it was outstanding. In fact when the chef walked out of the kitchen my group broke into spontaneous applause. We enjoyed lingering over breakfast in the charming dining room with the beautiful view, having lunch at the pool "in the sky" and in the evening the same dining room became a romantic setting. My group loved the hotel's location that is in walking distance to shopping and other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Sonesta.”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I got an excellent deal (60 dollars a night or so) on Priceline...and since it was a business trip, I wasn't paying for it anyway. Soon after arriving though, I could see I'd make an excellent choice. The location is awesome, in the Coconut Grove area, with the "CoCo Walk" nearby. In Miami, there are plenty of bad areas of town and one has to be rather careful about where they stay. This is in a good area of town. I'd still take precautions, but I never felt like I was in any danger. The room I had was beautiful. The view was awesome....and the view was even better from their outdoor pool that's on the 8th floor. My room had a full kitchen in it...and just a lot of space to move around in. I know some hotels put people in small rooms if they get a bargain on Priceline but apparently not here. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable service”
Reviews.Author: bali1000
Reviews.Content: On a recent holiday from Australia my parents stayed at this hotel. During this time my father suddnely passed away leaving my mother along way from home and grieving. The hotel staff were absolutetly amazing. In particular Claudia (Front Desk manageress) They cared for my mother until we could arrive some 36 hours later. The compassion and understanding shown by the staff at the hotel will never be forgotten by our family. Every staff member knew our situation and they were very sympathetic each time we spoke. It is this attention to service which is very rare these days and sets an example for others to follow. Well done Sonesta and I will definitetly go back under very diferent circumstances and enjoy my stay. Thanks Shane Blair.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Crowleymagic
Reviews.Content: I had read about the problems people had with the noise from the nightclub and requested that we be placed on the other side of the hotel. They did as requested and we had a fabulous stay. We rented a 2BR suite for the family and it was beautiful. Spacious and very reasonably priced. We ate at the restaurant for dinner and breakfast and it was very good. Sitting outside the first night was beautiful. The view over Biscayne Bay was gorgeous and the staff were excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: evenoelle
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at the Sonesta following our wedding. When we arrived, my husband mentioned that we just got married and they upgraded our room to a bay view room on the 21st floor. This hotel was immaculate. Each time we were walking in the hotel or around the hotel, we noticed people cleaning. (This is always a big plus for me!) All of the staff that we came across were very friendly and we genuinely felt welcome here. The room was a very nice size complete with a small kitchen type area that had a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, sink, and stove. The balcony view of Biscayne Bay was splendid. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were well equiped. We love fresh air so we slept with the balcony door open a bit and never heard any of the noise from the club downstairs that several of the other reviewers here have mentioned. The hotel is a short walk to the heart of Coconut Grove. This is a very nice hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “In line with my expectations”
Reviews.Author: madtoaster
Reviews.Content: Room are clean and confortable. There is a safety box and a vallet parking with very kind people. The swimming pool is well located with a beautiful view on the sea but it is a little bit small and noisy as one of the favourite game of young americans is to drink whisky for hours in the water. The evening, the center is very close with a lot of music, drinks. Be careful to the pickpockets. The day you can walk along the sea shore to see boats. There is a nice restaurant in the marina. Drawback: The air conditioning doesn't work very well in the room and the standard room doesn't have the fantastic view on the sea of luxury ones or suites. Be careful when you book this hotel as it's located in a new trendy area of Miami if you want to be in Miami Beach (South Beach 25 km from there).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Noise -- Bad Soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: las710
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Sonesta and I was very disappointed. We got a decent last minute deal on Hotwire and spent last Friday night at the hotel. First and foremost, there is a club next door that BLARES music until 3:00am on the weekends. We were on the 18th floor and the music was so loud I could not fall asleep until the club closed. When I called down to the front desk at 2:00am to complain, they were quick to answer that it would go on until 3:00am -- this has obviously been a major issue for them. I could actually make out the songs (at least those I recognized) and could hear the DJ announce "last call" -- IT WAS THAT BAD! The room were were in was cramped -- you could barely walk around the bed without bumping into the furniture around it. We had our 18-month-old with us which made this somewhat treacherous for her. We had to request a crib three times before they brought one up to the room, but luckliy it arrived before bedtime. The pool was quite small... much too small for the size of this hotel. But it was not terribly busy and warm. When we checked out, I complained about the club noise and they half-heartedly apologized. The receptionist said they receive a lot of complaints and forward them to the police in the hopes that they will be able to get the club closed down and that I should request an oceanside room next time... but that's all they said. They did not offer to reimburse us or even drop the $23 valet parking charges which I thought was the minimum they could do. I know we got a good price on hotwire.com ($105 including tax), but when I am paying for a 4-star hotel I expect to be able to sleep through the night, not be bothered by the adjacent noise. On the positive side... the location is nice and you can walk to lots of restaurants, etc. The lobby was nice and hip, as was the furniture in the rooms. The bed was very comfortable too... too bad I couldn't sleep. I will never again stay at this hotel and warn others to think twice before booking it on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights the last weekend in June. Property is very nice with GREAT balconies overlooking the bay. We found the rooms very spacious and a full size refrigerator was very handy. The exercise room was well equiped and not busy. We ate at a great restaurant Jaquars down the street. Would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the big crowds.

Reviews.Title: “quoth the raven...nevermore”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlLA
Reviews.Content: check in was like a 3-ring circus and took almost an hour, thanks to someone who wasnt even a front desk agent. when we went back to change rooms, the manager said to another front desk person "what was ____ doing here??" the rooms were decent and clean. they were also a nice size. they upgraded us to a corner suite with a wrap-around balcony. the room service is hit or miss. i loved my breakfast (chocolate chip pancakes) but my boyfriend hated his (french toast). the dinner is also mediocre. the angus burger was delish, but the hummus plate was so disgusting. we also tried to order food on the 'rooftop' pool. the cabana boy said it would be about 15 minutes. i patiently waited 30 minutes before deciding to cancel my order. when i did cancel, a manager came out making a huge deal out of it. all i wanted was some fried rice! but they took too long and i was over it. also note: the other reviewers are not exaggerating when they explain nikki beach. i was so uncomfortable and felt unsafe with all walks of life pouring out of that club at night time. the parking is terrible. the hotel is in a convenient location to a couple of decent places to eat. there's a pizza place on the same street as the hotel that is soooo good. there is also an american apparel! tripadvisor is gracious giving this hotel 4-stars. it must just be for the amenities the hotel offers, but they just don't hit it with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sonesta in Coconut Grove for four nights at the end of May. The reservation was booked by a family member for us as we had travelled to Florida for a graduation. Our room had a view of the bay and a fully equipped kitchenette. What a treat to be able to have water and drinks and snacks in the fridge and to make coffee. The king sized bed was supremely comfortable and made up with excellent quality sheets and pillows and down duvet. The bathroom, although small, had an abundance of excellent quality towels and top-of-line toiletries. Two spa-quality robes were in the closet freshly laundered for our use. The room itself was spacious, spotlessly clean, and fresh smelling. On two mornings, we had a great breakfast in the 8th floor restaurant overlooking the bay. Overall, for our purposes, it was a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding View”
Reviews.Author: Natcarib
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night due to a wedding that was held there, ceremony and reception. I found the property was well-mantained, and the room was very clean, airy and smelled fresh. Found the washroom in the lobby very clean and fresh, which is unusual for most hotels. The view from the room (20th floor) was great. The festivities was held on the eight floor and the reception hall was clean and the views from there were outstanding. The service was very good. My only regret is that I only stayed one night but would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: seminoletravler
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice hotel that takes care of their customers look elsewhere. We booked a 2 bed room suite that was to have a king bed in each room. One room had 2 twin beds pushed together with a lamb strip down the middle which was horrible. The other room's airconditioner did not work the entire stay and we had personal in the room the whole time trying to fix it. They even walked in our room without knocking just came right in. Finally they were going to move us after 2 hours at the front desk but we insisited on seeing the new room first (which they argued about) and sure enough one of the rooms had the same thing two twin beds pushed together. Where do hotels even get twin beds nowdays?? We pretty much spent our entire stay with this room problem. The front desk staff was horrible they would leave us standing there forever and were completely rude!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriceCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with my wife and my two children from April 24 until April 27 2008. We would highly recommend this hotel for several reasons. Coconut Grove is a very nice place at only 10-15 minutes driving from Miami Downtown and Biscayne Bay. The area is very safe with some nice restaurants and shops at only 2 minutes walking. The hotel itself is amazing: Very nice and friendly people and the rooms are very nice as well (we stayed in a one-room suite with a wonderful view on the Bay). We would like to give a special mention to the team in charge of the breakfast there, for their very friendly and efficient service. One disappointment: Very small swimming pool. We will go back there next time we stay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Get the right room before you check in”
Reviews.Author: Kittylover
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Sony-Ericsson Tennis service travel agency. We thought we were getting the best hotel, but much to our dismay, it was on the bottom of our list. The night we arrived, we were given a room on the 18th floor with a city view. The room was so small, we couldn't open the drawers on the armoire without sitting on the bed. The toilet was behind the bathroom door, so close that the door could smash you in the knees. We were'nt given any soap, and it took 2 calls to the desk, 2 hours apart, before soaps were delivered. We settled into sleep at 11PM. The sounds of the city were so loud we could not get to sleep. Finally at 2AM I called the front desk, and they told me the noise would continue until the bars close at 3AM. The bars are trying to get the city of Coconut Grove to extend the hours to 4AM. It literally sounded like a Rap band was in our room, it was so loud. The next morning we asked to be moved. We were moved to a bay side room, which was a little bigger and had a small balcony. This was a world of difference. It was quiet and we slept well. One problem with both rooms was the coffee pot. It was very nice of them to provide us with it, but there was nowhere to plug it in. Although it was nicely set up on top of the minifrige, it had to be moved into the bathroom to plug it in. To their favor, they did everything to move us, even giving us a better room. But, BEWARE. DO NOT get a room with a city view. The noise is deafening. I complement the staff in diligently working on moving us to a new room. They were full, and it was no small feat to change us around. They were very kind people to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Loved teh Sonesta”
Reviews.Author: leavemeonthebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre and post cruise at the Sonesta in Coconut Grove. Pre cruise we had a standard city view comared to UK hotels this was a large room. Post cruise we arrived back at 9.30am and were allowed to check in early and upgraded to a one bedroom bay view suite. Breakfast was excellent on the balcony. The pool area was very nice. Didn't seem to be too many holidaymakers, most people seemed to be there on business. I chose the Sonesta as it was close to restuarants. We are planning to go back to Miami next year however we would stay in either downtown Miami or South Beach to be nearer the beach

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but ask for the right room”
Reviews.Author: Lesdeak
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed at this hotel while at a conference in miami. Hotel is very nice but we had different experiences with our rooms so best to ask for a room with their kitchen, microwave, etc so you get the larger of the rooms available. Also, my room was on 19th floor with view of the bay which was beautiful. Pool was small but ok - and again had great view of the bay (from 8th floor). Nice location near shops and restaurants in coconut grove Co co walk. A bit far from south beach but we werent there for that reason. Watch the weather if going this month. one day it was 85 - 90 degrees and the next it was 66!!! bring variety of clothing. My friend said that the management was extremely inflexible with some of the problems she had with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and no service”
Reviews.Author: joanna50
Reviews.Content: We were given a free upgrade to a junior suite as standard rooms are not big enough to fit two beds yet, they give a rate for all the family staying in one room. The two children slept on a sofa-bed that was hideously uncomfortable. Our bed was superb and the bathrooms were good. All the suites back onto a night club that pounds out music until 4am. So, if you want a room big enough a family to fit in, you will be kept awake until the small hours by the adjacent Flavour nightclub. If you want breakfast in the restaurant you have to book a table or wait in line for up to one hour (on a Sunday when we tried) as the restaurant seats less than a tenth of the capacity of the hotel. Yet, if you want your complimentary breakfast in your room then you pay in full for it. This is an expensive hotel that looks great and has a nice pool, but the service is terrible and the noisy location let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CVWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Staff does its best to accomodate the guests. For example, our room was great, very comfortable bed and nice view but could hear a nightclub while trying to sleep. We were moved the same night to a satisfactory room by patient and nice staff. Nice robes.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: estabrks
Reviews.Content: There are both good and bad things about this hotel. I have stayed her three times toward the end of 2006. During the first stay we had a two bedroom waterfront room with living room and kitchen. The views and balcony were unbelievable. The living space was huge. However, the decor was just fair. It feels like it needs a renovation. The doorknob to our bathroom door fell off, as well as the handle on the toilet. In the second bedroom it literally rained water from above. They came to fix it several times. Each time they'd say, "it's all fixed" only to have it leak again a short time later. When we complained to the front desk they didn't seem that concerned about the leak and didn't have any other rooms to move us to. During our other stays we just had the run of the mill hotel room without a view. These are very small rooms, but the bathrooms are a nice size. I certainly would be disappointed if we'd paid for them, but were there on business. The location is very convenient to Cocowalk if that is of interest. The food at the restaurant is really good and the view is wonderful. We had both breakfast, dinner, and some drinks in the course of our stays. My biggest gripe is with the front desk staff. We got the WORST service there of any hotel I have ever stayed at and I travel a lot. On three occasions I waited my turn for over 20 minutes!! There was a problem with my bill during every stay. And, the front desk staff never acted interested or concerned in my problems with anything. I sent my comments in, but never heard back. Customer service is important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: Nice vast room with ocean view and great flat TV screen. The Kitchenette was also very useful as I stayed for a long time there. The staff was very helpful and nice. The fitness room at last floor was very clean and offered a nice view over the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel on a trash street”
Reviews.Author: wshlew
Reviews.Content: I guess the problem I've had is more to do with the area the hotel is located at than the hotel itself. First of all the "coconut walk" area is trashy. I wasn't really looking for that kind of environment so I wasn't pleased with where I was about. It is convinient because most of the restaurants are within walking distance from the hotel. Having said that, be cautious about walking around the area. There was a prostitute kept screaming at me "what do you need?" on the way to dinner, and on the way back from the dinner a group of drunken men at a pizza place next to the hotel made noises like "ching chang" when I walked by. The next day when I walked by again one of them asked for my moeny and when I said no he just yelled with awful racial slurs that I probably can't even mention on this site. (Yes, there are many crazy people in NYC, too, but somehow it's so much more hostile outside of Manhattan when these things happen because at these settings it is very one-on-one; In NYC I am surrounded by another 50 people walking by at the same time.) The first night there I had the worst what it supposed to be French food at this cheesy bistro. The next day I ate at Cheesecake Factory just to be safe. (At least they don't try to be something they are not.) Now the hotel: Once I went in I was safe. Everyone was courteous, helpful including the valet attendents. The room was small but if you have the room with a view, the view is great. For two people it might need to be upgraded for the size. My room came with a made-up king bed: Two twin or full size mattresses were pulled together. They weren't quite leveled so I just had to pick one side. The bathroom was fine and the tub was deep. The wall seemed pretty thin because I kept hearing my neighboor's TV, bathroom vent going off and the shower noise. The gym was tired and dated, pool seemed okay, but the lounge chairs were worn out and dirty. The housekeeping for the room was very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TijuanaJuan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a city view room before a cruise and a bay view/pool view room after the cruise. The hotel room is within walking distance to many restaurants. Our rooms were a little small, but made up for it with comfort and luxury. All the staff was pleasant and helpful. Would definately stay here again if given the opportunity. Parking is valet only through the hotel, but there are a couple of public parking decks nearby if valet is not your thing. The cost for valet is a flat fee though and was very reasonable. The pool had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Luxe for the Least Price”
Reviews.Author: LeBonRobert
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta Coconut Grove is a great combination of quality, service and value. The Sonesta is comparable to other four star properties with little touches that lend a boutique flair. The lobby nor the restaurant nor the pool nor the fitness center are "grand" yet I found each more intimate and serene than more well known chain hotels. Our room was the Superior category, the smallest offered. If you planning to spend a lot of time in your room you may want to upgrade to the next category but we found it just fine. The bedding and the bed itself were extremely comfortable. The bath is modern and in good condition but simple. We did not have a flat screen TV as shown in some of the on line pictures but perhaps the upgraded categories offer that. Our rate included the oft-maligned "continental breakfast". We found the French pastries and juice absolutely delicious. You can upgrade to a more substantial breakfast but the price difference did not seem worth it to us. Any and all service requests were honored the first time. We found the staff to be generally professional and congenial at the Front Desk, valet and Restaurant. Dollar for dollar you are going to get more hotel at a better price at the Sonesta Coconut Grove than South Beach or downtown. Coconut Grove has its own personality without quite as much insanity as South Beach. Unless you are doing the beach every day, Coconut Grove is a great alternative to South Beach or downtown. You have plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance and even more within a five minute drive. You are ten minutes to downtown and twenty to South Beach. I would definately book the Sonesta again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: NovaTam
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta Hotel and Suites in Coconut Grove was very nice. We booked a 1 bedroom Biscayne suite for my husband, 16 y/o son and myself. The suite was very nice! It had a full kitchen, nice balcony with 2 entrances leading out from the suite and even a washer and dryer! Our view was of the pool area and the bay beyond...very nice. We felt that this was one of the most comfortable hotel stays that we've had. The property was very nice and clean with daily housekeeping, daily newspaper, free WiFi and very pleasant front desk staff! This property is in a great location of Coconut Grove and you can get around on foot to many areas. They also offer a free shuttle bus to South Beach. There are quite a few places to eat in the immediate area and the hotel has a restaurant as well. I would recommend this hotel to families, couples and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hurongirlOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a cruise. The hotel is well appointed and spotlessly clean. Very comfortable beds. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Nice small rooftop restaurant served a very pleasant breakfast. The neighbourhood was great, with several dining options and some shopping. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ntasha783
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the superficial appearance of a luxury 3 1/2 star hotel, however the service and accommodations are a far cry from outstanding. Beware of the "complimentary" continental breakfast because you may end up being charged upon check out for foods that were not included. When you go into the restaurant were breakfast is held only certain foods on the buffet are complimentary. I was surprised upon checkout with a charge for $70 for breakfast that wasn't included. They have a computer in the front desk with internet access guarded by a person from the concierge to insure that you only check in your flights and print boarding passes. I asked to check my email and he informed me that I could not, but I could go to the business center, type in my credit card number, and use the Internet as long as my heart desired. Finally, if you don't read anything else READ THIS This hotel is not one that is customer focused. They are friendly but in a superficial, all I care about is the money you will spend, sort of way. Not everyone was this way, but most were. As a person who is big on customer focus and stellar customer service I would not recommend this hotel for anyone on vacation- business trips maybe. I was disappointed to say the least. They leave me the impression of an upper-class business swindler and I can only imagine how many people fall victim unaware.

Reviews.Title: “So very pleased (and we are picky!)”
Reviews.Author: Lite-Traveler11
Reviews.Content: The bedding was perhaps the best I've every seen - just like they show on their website. A rare situation of what you see is what you get. The employees were kind and helpful. Even though we had two maintenance issues (tub water didn't drain properly, and an alarm was going off in another room for at least an hour), we were still thrilled with the hotel because the issues were resolved quickly. To our surprise, the room included a kitchenette with a refrig, two burners and a microwave. We didn't use it but it was nice to know that it was there.

Reviews.Title: “The best in the Grove area for the price..”
Reviews.Author: mwafrica4
Reviews.Content: During a recent business visit to Coconut Grove, my company had made a reservation through the USA office for the Grand Bay Hotel.. Well..the state of the Grand Bay was unbelievably terriblle., especially for the ridiculous price that I was paying.Through my customer office in the Grove I got into the Sonesta.It was a huge improvement. Although the building is a bit bland, the reception, the staff, and the cleanliness of the room was just great ( If there is one thing I cannot abide, that is a dirty room, and the Grand Bay was dirty !) So a commendation for the Sonesta is due. I had looked at two other hotels and they were the Double Tree and the Mayfair. The Double Tree was not bad (I had stayed there before) and it was the least expensive. The Mayfair is meant to be a 'Leading Hotel Of The World' group, but didn't have good reviews and looked a bit 'tired' when I went to see it, and it has no pool. My room in the Sonesta (139 usd) had a small kitchen, sitting room, bedroom, walk-in wardrobe, and two toilets one bath. Nice view over the Grove. Two TVs, coffee maker, etc. Swimming pool on the 8th floor was a bit small but had clean water. The breakfast was included and served in the restaurant on the 8th with a nice view over the bay. So there you go ! Thanks Sonesta. Keep it going !-- Tony. Luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “Eucalyptus-Scented Lobby Wins!”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacays
Reviews.Content: The hotel's dÃ©cor was a modern one. The lobby gave us a sense of aromatherapy, filled with the beautiful scent of eucalyptus and the space was accentuated with ivory couches and simple foliage. It immediately set off a comfortable environment once we walked through the entrance. The front desk was extremely helpful. Check-in took no time at all. We arrived quite late in the night and they quickly assigned us a room. The king-size bedroom was spacious with a fully equipped kitchen, a balcony with a beautiful view of the Biscayne Bay and the bathroom had bathrobes and deliciously scented products from Italy. The bed was very comfortable, my husband who has had 3 back surgeries enjoyed it very much. The bell staff helped us move our luggage into the car even though we didn't pay for their valet service. The only downside I could think of is the stairs leading up to the hotel entrance, I suggest a ramp so that people with heavy luggage wouldn't have to struggle to move their belongings up to the landing. The hotelâ€™s Peruvian restaurant has a great breakfast menu with a panoramic view of Key Biscayne. The bald waiter was very helpful and courteous, he should be employee of the month. The Fitness Center is full of Precor equipments. They offered green apples by the water pitcher which I thought was a pretty nice touch. If you drive, use the public parking lot directly next door to the hotel. It costs $6 for 24-hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Good Buy”
Reviews.Author: EasternAir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sonesta May 23-29. We booked a One Bedroom Biscayne Suite (highly recommend) through AAA website for $240/night. We previously stayed at the Hyatt and found the Sonesta to be a much better value, better location, better staff. The suite was clean and comfortable. The suite has a full kitchen with a living/dining room, a separate bedroom with full bath w/whirlpool tub and a half bath off the kitchen with a washer and dryer (great convenience!). We found the staff to be friendly and accomodating. We parked our car at the public parking garage ($6/day) located directly next to the hotel. The hotel is within a short walk to Coco Walk which includes an AMC movie theater and several small shops, restuarants (Johnny Rockets, Cheesecake Factory, TuTu Tango, Starbucks) and Bars (Coyote Ugly, Fat Tuesday). Around the corner you can find additional restaurants and shops. We did encounter some pan handling but, nothing to worry about. Although we didn't have time to use it, the gym looked great. New equipment a few Precor treadmills, elliptical, and weights. The gym is located on the Penthouse floor and has a great view of Miami and Coco Walk. A nice touch were the towels, water, and fresh apples. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would look to stay here again when returning to Miami. I researched lots of hotels (Marriott SOBE, Ritz Coconut Grove, Grove Isle Club, Fountainbleu, Doral) and found this to be the best value for the $$ and location. Close enough to SOBE yet far enough away.

Reviews.Title: “Service Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: SmallHotelConnoiseur
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta is a large rack rate hotel. We found the lobby to be gorgeous but the typical room to be quite small. The bed was very comfortable with a very nice duvet. The bay view was lovely if you don't mind paying a little extra. Unfortunately, we had a disappointing experience with customer service. We tried to use the in-room hairdryer and discovered it was broken. After three calls to the desk in two hours we still did not have a working hairdryer. Finally, we approached a maid cleaning an adjacent room and were delighted that she understood our situation and allowed us to switch hairdryers. (Memo to Management: Keep the crew that was working the 18th floor.) Talk about service coming from the ground up! The hotel abuts one of the main shopping districts in Coconut Grove. Many of the establishments looked tourist weary and the restaurants seemed expensive next to other areas of Miami. Do try the Chart House - it was excellent. For a more sophisticated experience, try the Westin Colonade Hotel in Coral Cables.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a Miami area stay!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnLeftCoast
Reviews.Content: What a terrific place! We booked a Biscayne Suite for a low AAA rate. The 19th floor wraparound terrace with its views of the marina, the park (although you can't see it, the Barnacle Historic Site is there, beneath the trees) and the pool, was fantastic. The two bedroom suite affords loads of pricacy, as it is actually two hotel rooms with an entrance foyer--so each bedroom's occupants have complete privacy . Then there is a small but modern kithchen area, a washer/dryer in the third bathroom, and living area. The price of this huge suite was half of what we were about to pay for a much smaller ONE bedroom suite at Loew's. We went to So Beach one day and were so glad we didnt stay there. It was loud, hectic, and like the worst of Las Vegas. Returning to the little streets and cafes of Coconut Grove was lovely. The staff at Sonesta is excellent!!!! Everyone is friendly, knowledgable about the area, and courteous and helpful. The bellman/general assistant Jouvert (spelling?) was particularly outstanding. We used the valet parking--yes, a bit of a splurge, but a treat to have the car waitng for us when needed. The pool was clear, clean, and sparkiing, with enough room to swim laps. There was rarely anyone else there or in the hot tub. One night there was a wedding which interfered with our use of the pool--not officially, we just felt a bit awkward swimming in front of the wedding guests who were in adjoining reception area with patio adjacent to the pool deck. Only two negatives: the hallway on the floor leading to our suite had a somewhat mildewed, humid scent. Howeve, there was no trace of it, once in the suite or its entryway . In fact, the rooms were perfectly clean, wtih spotless bathrooms. The other problem was that one day, shower pressure varied--sometimes strong, sometimes barely more than a stream. I forgot to mention this while we were there, but have no doubt that had we done so, it would have been looked into. If you stay there, try the gelato at the place on Main Highway, around the corner from the hotel (NOT the gelato at Cocoo Walk). Main Highway is a great place for strollig, for cafes, adn in the daytime , to visit the Barnacle Historic Site. I can't imagine a better place to stay in the Miami area, and if we return, we'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: teach32
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on the Sonesta we gave it a try. What a wonderful experience, especially since we were leaving a N'easter behing! Check in was very smooth and all the employees friendly. The room was great, the bed soo comfortabel. We had a king-sized bed with a microwave, refrigerator and and stove. Everything was very clean and the view from the balcony of the city with Miami in the distance-super. I was a little concerned about noise since others had written about it, but it was very quiet onthe 11th floor. The pool was very nice and warm, although small and not too many lounge chairs. Don't forget to go up to the exercise room. There are windows overlooking the city and bay.akes you want to work out! We didnt eat at teh restaurant, but it smelled great and looked nice overlooking the Bay. We wil definitely return to the Sonesta next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie1emma2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Check in went very smooth. We stayed in a two bedroom suite overlooking the bay. The room was very clean. It had two bedrooms, 2 and 1/2 bathrooms, a full kitchen and washer and dryer. The location was great. Alot of close restaurants within walking distance. The pool area was very nice with a bar, comfortable chairs and towels. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: NjBeachgoer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The pool and pool bar (8th floor) were small but still great with a beatiful view overlooking the bay. Breakfast and lunch were good at the resteraunt. Service was friendly all around. Room was nice and clean with great bed linens. Not the Ritz....but a great value for $150. No one told us about the free shuttle???

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a good price”
Reviews.Author: lily01
Reviews.Content: I travel to Miami for work and generally like smaller hotels. I used to stay at the Wyndham, Coconut Grove which I have heard has been sold and gone downhill. My expectations were moderate going to the sonesta but the price was right. My room was on the 18th floor with a partial view of the water. I was surprised at the size of the suite--very roomy, 1.5 baths, kitchen and a huge balcony. It was comfortable, but the decor was a bit drab. I brought my laptop and there was free internet access. The pool is lovely, nice moderate temp with a pretty view of the bay. However, there was limited lounge chair seating. I had lunch one day at the restaurant-good service, great view and good food. Coco walk is right out the door and there are numerous places to eat and feel comfortable eating alone. My only issues were with the front desk service. Every time I called for the concierge no one answered & it would go to voice mail. Also, it is noisey at night, no matter how high a room you have because of coco walk. All in all the hotel is clean and comfortable and it was a perfectly good stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice...”
Reviews.Author: Jersey4life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sonesta as part of a wedding room block. Since this was a first time in Coconut Grove (visited South Beach the year prior) we did not know what to expect. At first glance at check in the hotel is quite lovely and the staff are very friendly. Once we arrived in our room which was a bay view we were quite surprised by the size. Our room was rather small. The bathroom itself seemed larger than the bedroom area. And after much searching, we realized the room had no closet just a large dresser to hang your clothes. We decided to rent a car but the proximity of local spots was walking distance... i.e. Cheesecake Factory, Johnny Rockets, Hooters, CVS, etc... If you do rent a car do not utilize the valet parking at $18 a day there is a public lot right next door for about $3 a day ... but on the weekend there is a $6 flat fee for the bar hoppers. And if you do not know, Coconut Grove is a very posh city...every other car we saw had to be a Hummer and/or Range Rover... Since we were there with the rest of the bridal party... we did get a chance to see the 1BR suite and that was quite larger with a full kitchen and nice size living room. Because hubby & I are more beach bums... we felt we got more for our money on South Beach and do not see ourselves returning anytime soon to Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, well located, excellent service. Stayed 5 nights. My rundown of highlights and lowlights: - porter/valet service: excellent, extremely professional - hotel room: spacious, well-furnished, amazing bed and linens, nice bathroom. Overall, very nice but not impeccable like Sonesta in other cities and some things were dirty (telephone, clock radio, coffeemaker). - dining room: not large & may wait at breakfast hour, food is average, service very good, superb view of Bay of Biscayne - Although located in a high class neighbourhood, the hotel itself is situated at a rather non-descript junction of 2 angled streets. And you have to walk on McFarlane Rd - a junky street - to reach Cocowalk, which is essentially a huge tourist trap. But at least you can walk a block and half to Starbucks if you just want a cafe au lait for breakfast. (If you 're staying at Biltmore Hotel in Coral Gables, forget it!) I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. TIP: The free shuttle can take you to some top attractions, incl. South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “No Hotel Feel to it -- More like a doorman building”
Reviews.Author: WENEEDAVACA
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet room on the 16th floor; only occasionally heard street noise from motorcycles, etc. I took other tripadvisor recommendations and requested a high floor. When we go there they had us on 11; I requested a higher floor, and they gave us 16. You don't want to be close to the 8th floor because that is where the pool, restaurant, and outdoor bar [if you want to call it a bar because the bartender is always MIA] are. Room is basic; bed was a little too soft for me, but comfortable linens. Balcony with 2 chairs is nice to have, overlooking the Biscayne Bay. There is no ocean right there; you must rent a car or you will feel too isolated. You want to request the ocean view, even though it is really a bay view. You don't want to be facing CoCo walk which has a very late and busy nightlife. There is a kitchenette in the room, so you can buy things and keep them in a small frig, or make your own coffee if you wish. There is NO gift or snack shop or any shops for that matter, in the Sonesta. There is no turn-down service at night, but if you want fresh towels you can tell them, and they are happy to refresh your towels at night. Also, very limited breakfast restaurants here. Only decent breakfast places to eat near by are Coco cafe [very limited menu], and Green Street [great omemlettes made any way you like; very busy and service can be very slow; tell the hostess you want to see your waiter as soon as you are seated]. There is also a Starbucks a few doors down to the right where you can read the New York Times and relax. It is always very crowded with a line. The pool is miniscule with very few chairs and NO lifeguard . Again, another tripadvisor member mentioned this, so I knew not to expect a great pool scene. But since we took many day trips, the pool was not the main priority. There is only 1 restaurant with a very limited menu. If you are NOT the adventurous type and rely on a good concierge, this is NOT the place to stay. They are pleasant enough, but not knowlegable, the same with the front desk crew. To save some money park at the garage next door which is $5 each time you enter, as opposed to the twentysomething dollars that the hotel charges for each 24 hours. There are other $5 parking options in the neighborhood. This hotel has many permanent residents here who own their units, so my take on this place is that if feels much more like a highrise doorman building with basic amenities, than a hotel with lots of amenities. Fitness room on top floor is okay if you just want to keep up with your regular routine -- nothing fancy, again very basic. Also, NO attendants in the fitness room. If you want luxury go to the Ritz-Carleton around the corner; it is gorgeous and the service is first class all the way around. Of course you will pay through the nose for that. If you are not planning on spending much time in the hotel as we did, the Sonesta is just fine. Just do your research ahead of time, so that you have an agenda for your visit. I recommend South Beach, Key Largo, and Key Biscaynne. If you love bike riding go to Key Biscaynne. It's not expensive and it's very flat and pretty, and they have a state park there to explore by bike or foot. South Beach is good for shopping, and of course happy hour. It has become so popular and crowded that biking there is frustrating because you are always concerned about running into someone. There are also 2 fun restaurant rows you have to visit. One is Espaniola Way, and the other is Lincoln Road. Don't bother wasting your money to go to the Bass Museum; extremely disappointing as there was nothing much to see. You can also rent chairs with cushions on the beach in South Beach for the day. South Beach is a real scene, so we chose not to stay there, but it is fun to visit. Key Largo is a drive, but we found a great tiki bar/restaurant right on the water called Snapper's and had great half price drinks and appetizers [awesome shrimp and oysters, and sooo cheap!] We left late and were stuck in traffic so we didn't get to do any exploring down there. Many people told us to go to Islamorada [the next Key], but we'll have to do that next time and leave earlier. There is major road construction going on along U.S.1 South, which we did not know about ahead of time, so be warned. Take Card Sound Road as an alternate route to avoid a lot of the traffic; do not take US 1 all the way down to the Keys. We stayed at the Sonesta for 4 nights. Overall, it was a nice get-away, and when we got bumped up to first class on our return flight it was icing on the cake! We took this trip without our 2 kids, and we had a really nice time just having alone time and exploring. There's lots to explore and see if you have wheels. We certainly did not see everything, but hopefully some of these tips will make your visit more enjoyable!! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BGI99
Reviews.Content: The Sonesta was great!!!! - from the time we arrived we were treated with great service and very polite staff. We booked a romm for USD 120 per night through an online booking service. We were given a room on the 19th floor with a corner wedge balcony with a view of the ocean - fantastic. The room was very comfortable and everything like a/c, t.v etc worked well. The restaurant could use some help however as service can be slow, but food very tasty!. It is in a great loacation with many activities close by. I would agree that the vlet parking is expensive, but very nice to have your car waiting for you when you come down into the lobby. The $5 public parking is right next to the hotel if you want to park yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue020
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was wonderful - the Biscayne Suite, the public areas, the staff, the location, the view; I could go on for ever!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl4321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at this hotel. We had family and friends who had been disapointed in Miami before by second rate hotels that were billed as classy and expensive online. So on our first trip to Miami we didn't know what to expect. What we found in the Sonesta was a very nice, low-key and friendly place. We had reserved a Bay-View King room, but when we arrived at our room the door locking mechanism wouldn't lock. With a single phone call to the front desk a maintenance person responded immediately. When he found he couldn't fix the problem quickly, the hotel moved us to a wonderful suite that looked over the bay. The rooms were simple, elegant and comfortable. The staff was always friendly and more than willing to help with any requests. I personally enjoyed sangria night at the poolside bar- very nice! The hotel was close to everything, specifically a Starbucks just a half a block down- I have to have my coffee in the morning. The valet parking was totally worth the extra money- it was secure and much less stressful than trying to find a parking space. For the rate that we paid (under $100 on an internet site) I was more than impressed. Also, the concierge Chaz was super friendly- he gave a lot of good info. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again if back in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds like it's better to book an internet deal than direct”
Reviews.Author: jill052
Reviews.Content: From my experience, most hotels would usually give you a better deal if you call them direct which we did and got the parking package for one night at $169 (with taxes, etc. it ended up costing $189). This was supposed to include free valet parking and free breakfast according to the man I talked to when we booked. We stayed Sat. night, Sept. 23, which looks like it's the same weekend that the previous lady stayed for $110. The hotel is clean, and very well done as a renovated older hotel. It has a new sleak, modern decor and our room had a king bed as promised with white linens which I wish all hotels would use. I also liked the coffee maker in the room and the paper at the door in the morning. We didn't feel like we were told the "whole truth" when we were told we'd have free breakfast with our room package. As it ended up, it was a free continental breakfast. We weren't real upset by this news so went to breakfast the next morning to find out that the hotel only gives you ONE free continental breakfast. I felt embarrassed and wanted to leave but the gracious lady managing their restaurant insisted we stay and she told us to help ourselves. (the fresh fruit and pastries, juice and coffee were all wonderful and the restaurant is overlooking the water with an outdoor patio that was perfect for a lazy morning). However, when we asked again at the desk as we check out, whether the breakfast for one was a mistake, we were told,"No." Very, very strange. So if you're offered a "free breakfast" with a package, ask if it's full or continental and if only one person in your party of two using the room gets to eat.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: Ok I have looked far and wide for hotels in Miami and took a chance on this one. It was great for $110 a night. You are close to everything in the Grove, plus ins central so South Beach is 10 minutes away. The rooms were not that big I had a normal king bed in a standard room woth no balcony. However for 20 bucks more a night I could have...Im just cheap. The room service for breakfast was amazing and well worth it. The staff was on top of anything I asked for. You have to have a drink outside by the pool on the 7th floor, its really cool. Dont valet your car! There is a parking garage right next to the hotel (actually connected) its usually 6 bucks for 24 hours...only if there is an attendant then is a 12 buck maximum (1.50 an hour). My suggestion is look around there are lots that charge 5 bucks for 24 hours..use them since the hotel charged 19bucks a night for valet. Oh and here is a trick, if you pay your parking stub from the garage next to the hotel at those automated machines..you have 8 hours to use the stub to get out....get it? I paid $1.50 at the machine and didnt have to use the ticket to leave for another 8 hours saving me a lot!!! Youll see those machine when you drive into the garage.....warning though, on the weekends the garage gets crowded with club hopping nuts..not safe to venture in there alone if your a girl. Just use common sense or ask the concierge to have security escort you which they will do. But the hotel is the only hotel I will use from now on. Book on the sonesta web site, and click on florida resident discount...its cheaper than the pulished rates and they never check..LOL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sonesta”
Reviews.Author: Leslinek
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-bedroom suite for 5 nights and enjoyed the high quality accomodations and service. The Sonesta is very clean and well maintained, light years ahead of pricier hotels in South Beach where we usually stay. The view of the Bay is spectacular. The staff was the friendliest and most efficient we've run across anywhere in our numerous Miami visits. We followed the advice of other reviewers who suggested we park in the public garage next door (literally) to the Hotel and paid $3 a night ($6 on weekends) rather than the $18 charged by the valet service (which might be a better deal if you enter and exit several times a day). The 8th floor pool is surprisingly large especially compared to roof-top pools in SoBe. We will certainly stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove
HotelInfo.Address: 2889 McFarlane Road, Miami, FL 33133
